original: 'du byed rnams 'gags pas rnam par shes pa dang ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba 'gag go zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams 'gags pas rnam par shes pa dang ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba 'gag go zhes bya bas ni /
translated: The cessation of the formative forces results in the cessation of consciousness, name-and-form, the six sense-fields, contact, and feeling.üîΩThus, there is no afflicted view of the self, nor the afflicted view of holding to an extreme, nor over-estimation of one's own views, nor over-estimation of one's own morality and asceticism.

original: rnam par smin pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa med do //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa med do //
translated: The cessation of ignorance results in the cessation of the formative forces.üîΩThus, there is no afflicted view of the self, nor the afflicted view of holding to an extreme, nor over-estimation of one's own views, nor over-estimation of one's own morality and asceticism.üîΩThe cessation of craving results in the cessation of grasping.

original: srid pa 'gags pas skye ba dang rga shi 'gag go zhes bya bas ni skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa med do //
analyzed: srid pa 'gags pas skye ba dang rga shi 'gag go zhes bya bas ni skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa med do //
translated: The cessation of existence results in the cessation of birth, and the cessation of old age and death.

original: de lta bas na sdug bsngal bar byed pa gang yin pa dang / gang gis sdug bsngal bar byed pa dang / sdug bsngal ba gang yin pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi rgyu gang yin pa de dag spangs pa bstan to //
analyzed: de lta bas na sdug bsngal bar byed pa gang yin pa dang / gang gis sdug bsngal bar byed pa dang / sdug bsngal ba gang yin pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi rgyu gang yin pa de dag spangs pa bstan to //
translated: Thus, the abandonment of that which causes suffering, that by which one suffers, that which is suffering, and the cause of suffering, has been taught.

original: gzhan yang las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa spangs pas rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bde ba 'thob bo //
analyzed: gzhan yang las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa spangs pas rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bde ba 'thob bo //
translated: Moreover, through the abandonment of the affliction of action, one attains the bliss of perfect enlightenment.

original: nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa spangs pas kha na ma thob med pa'i bde ba 'thob bo //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa spangs pas kha na ma thob med pa'i bde ba 'thob bo //
translated: Through the abandonment of the affliction of the mental afflictions, one attains the bliss of being without demerit.

original: @5b rnam par smin pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa spangs pas nye bar zhi ba'i bde ba 'thob bo //
analyzed: @5b rnam par smin pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa spangs pas nye bar zhi ba'i bde ba 'thob bo //
translated: He obtains the bliss of peace through the abandonment of the defilement of retribution.

original: skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa spangs pas phung po med pa'i bde ba 'thob ste /
analyzed: skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa spangs pas phung po med pa'i bde ba 'thob ste /
translated: He obtains the bliss of the absence of aggregates through the abandonment of the defilement of birth.

original: bde bar byed pa gang yin pa dang / gang gis bde bar byed pa dang / bde ba gang yin pa dang / bde ba'i rgyu gang yin pa de dag thob pa ni nyon mongs pa med pa zhes bshad do //
analyzed: bde bar byed pa gang yin pa dang / gang gis bde bar byed pa dang / bde ba gang yin pa dang / bde ba'i rgyu gang yin pa de dag thob pa ni nyon mongs pa med pa zhes bshad do //
translated: The attainment of that which causes bliss, that by which one causes bliss, the bliss itself, and the cause of bliss are explained as being the absence of defilement.

original: dgra bcom pa zhes bya bas ni sbyin gnas kyi yon tan bstan to //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa zhes bya bas ni sbyin gnas kyi yon tan bstan to //
translated: The word ‚ÄúArhat‚Äù indicates the quality of being a worthy recipient of gifts.

original: zag pa zad ces bya bas ni dag pa'i yon tan bstan to //
analyzed: zag pa zad ces bya bas ni dag pa'i yon tan bstan to //
translated: The words ‚Äúhis impurities are destroyed‚Äù indicate the quality of being pure.

original: nyon mongs pa med ces bya bas ni sdug bsngal med par bstan te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med ces bya bas ni sdug bsngal med par bstan te /
translated: The words ‚Äúhe is without defilement‚Äù indicate the absence of suffering.

original: 'di ni de gsum gyi bye brag go //
analyzed: 'di ni de gsum gyi bye brag go //
translated: This is the difference between these three.

original: dbang dang ldan par gyur pa zhes bya bas ni de dag gi dbang du 'jig rten rnams gyur pa'am /
analyzed: dbang dang ldan par gyur pa zhes bya bas ni de dag gi dbang du 'jig rten rnams gyur pa'am /
translated: The words ‚Äúhe has attained mastery over his mind‚Äù indicate that the world is subject to the power of these three.

original: 'jig rten rnams kyi dbang du bdag gyur te sdug par gyur pa'am /üîΩde dag gi sems dbang du byas pa'am /
analyzed: 'jig rten rnams kyi dbang du bdag gyur te sdug par gyur pa'am / de dag gi sems dbang du byas pa'am /
translated: I have become the master of the world, and I am happy.üîΩI have brought their minds under control.üîΩ

original: dbang rnams thob pa'i phyir dbang dang ldan par gyur pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dbang rnams thob pa'i phyir dbang dang ldan par gyur pa zhes bya'o //
translated: One is called a lord of the world because one is the master of the world, because one is the master of the minds of the world, and because one is the master of the powers.

original: dbang ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: dbang ni bzhi ste /
translated: The powers are four:

original: rdzu 'phrul la dbang ba dang / dbang po la dbang ba dang / ting nge 'dzin la dbang ba dang / shes rab la dbang ba'o //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul la dbang ba dang / dbang po la dbang ba dang / ting nge 'dzin la dbang ba dang / shes rab la dbang ba'o //
translated: the power of supernormal knowledge, the power of the faculties, the power of concentration, and the power of wisdom.

original: de la rdzu 'phrul la dbang bas ni sems can gyi 'jig rten dang snod kyi 'jig rten de dag gi dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la rdzu 'phrul la dbang bas ni sems can gyi 'jig rten dang snod kyi 'jig rten de dag gi dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: By the power of supernormal knowledge, one is the master of the world of sentient beings and the world of receptacles.

original: dbang po la dbang bas ni spyod lam nye bar zhi bas de dag la 'jig rten dga' ba skyes so //
analyzed: dbang po la dbang bas ni spyod lam nye bar zhi bas de dag la 'jig rten dga' ba skyes so //
translated: By the power of the faculties, one is the master of the minds of the world, because the world is delighted by one's peaceful behavior.

original: ting nge 'dzin la dbang bas ni de dag gi sems dbang du byas so //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la dbang bas ni de dag gi sems dbang du byas so //
translated: By the power of concentration, one is the master of the world's minds, because one has control over the minds of the world.

original: shes rab la dbang bas ni nyon mongs pa dang / las dang / rnam par smin pa thams cad bcad de /
analyzed: shes rab la dbang bas ni nyon mongs pa dang / las dang / rnam par smin pa thams cad bcad de /
translated: By the power of wisdom, one is the master of the powers, because one has cut off all the afflictions, actions, and fruitions.

original: 'ching ba las grol ba bzhin du rang dbang du gyur pa'i phyir dbang thob pa'o //
analyzed: 'ching ba las grol ba bzhin du rang dbang du gyur pa'i phyir dbang thob pa'o //
translated: He has attained mastery because he is free like one released from bondage.

original: de la dbang po la dbang bas ni spyod lam gyis bzhugs pa thob pa'o //
analyzed: de la dbang po la dbang bas ni spyod lam gyis bzhugs pa thob pa'o //
translated: By mastery of the faculties, he attains the abode of the way of life.

original: ting nge 'dzin la dbang bas ni lha'i bzhugs pa dang / tshangs pa'i bzhugs pa thob po //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la dbang bas ni lha'i bzhugs pa dang / tshangs pa'i bzhugs pa thob po //
translated: By mastery of concentration, he attains the abode of the gods and the abode of Brahma.

original: rdzu 'phrul la dbang bas ni mngon par shes pas rnam par rol pa'i bzhugs pa thob po //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul la dbang bas ni mngon par shes pas rnam par rol pa'i bzhugs pa thob po //
translated: By mastery of psychic power, he attains the abode of the play of the higher knowledge.

original: shes rab la dbang bas ni 'phags pa'i bzhugs pa thob po //
analyzed: shes rab la dbang bas ni 'phags pa'i bzhugs pa thob po //
translated: By mastery of wisdom, he attains the abode of the noble ones.

original: de la dbang po la dbang bas ni tshul khrims kyi phung po yongs su rdzogs so //
analyzed: de la dbang po la dbang bas ni tshul khrims kyi phung po yongs su rdzogs so //
translated: By mastery of the faculties, he perfects the aggregate of morality.

original: rdzu 'phrul la dbang bas ni ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po yongs su rdzogs so //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul la dbang bas ni ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po yongs su rdzogs so //
translated: By mastery of psychic power, he perfects the aggregate of concentration.

original: ting nge 'dzin la dbang bas ni shes rab kyi phung po yongs su rdzogs so //üîΩshes rab la dbang bas ni rnam @6a * //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la dbang bas ni shes rab kyi phung po yongs su rdzogs so // shes rab la dbang bas ni rnam @6a * //
translated: By mastery of concentration, he perfects the aggregate of wisdom.

original: par grol ba'i phung po yongs su rdzogs so //
analyzed: par grol ba'i phung po yongs su rdzogs so //
translated: By mastery of wisdom, he perfects the aggregate of liberation.

original: tshul khrims kyis ni nyes par spyod pa'i 'ching ba las rnam par grol lo //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyis ni nyes par spyod pa'i 'ching ba las rnam par grol lo //
translated: By morality, one is freed from the bondage of evil conduct.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyis ni srid pa'i 'ching ba las rnam par grol lo //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyis ni srid pa'i 'ching ba las rnam par grol lo //
translated: By concentration, one is freed from the bondage of existence.

original: shes rab kyis ni lta ba ngan pa'i 'ching ba las rnam par grol lo//
analyzed: shes rab kyis ni lta ba ngan pa'i 'ching ba las rnam par grol lo//
translated: By wisdom, one is freed from the bondage of false views.

original: rnam par grol bas ni srid pa'i 'ching ba las rnam par grol lo //
analyzed: rnam par grol bas ni srid pa'i 'ching ba las rnam par grol lo //
translated: By liberation, one is freed from the bondage of the propensities.

original: de bas na 'ching ba las rnam par grol ba'i phyir rang dbang grub po //
analyzed: de bas na 'ching ba las rnam par grol ba'i phyir rang dbang grub po //
translated: Therefore, because of being freed from bondage, one is independent.

original: rang dbang yod pas na rang nyams thob pa'i phyir dbang dang ldan par gyur pa zhes bya'o //üîΩsems shin tu rnam par grol ba zhes bya bas ni srid pa'i phyogs kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos thams cad med par bstan to //
analyzed: rang dbang yod pas na rang nyams thob pa'i phyir dbang dang ldan par gyur pa zhes bya'o // sems shin tu rnam par grol ba zhes bya bas ni srid pa'i phyogs kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos thams cad med par bstan to //
translated: Because of being independent, one is said to have attained self-mastery, because of having attained self-mastery.üîΩBy his mind is completely liberated, all the dharmas of defilement on the side of existence are shown to be non-existent.

original: shes rab shin tu rnam par grol ba zhes bya bas ni ma rig pa'i phyogs rnams med par bstan to //
analyzed: shes rab shin tu rnam par grol ba zhes bya bas ni ma rig pa'i phyogs rnams med par bstan to //
translated: By his wisdom is completely liberated, all the dharmas of ignorance on the side of non-existence are shown to be non-existent.

original: 'di ltar 'dod chags dang rnam par bral ba'i phyir sems shin tu rnam par grol bas sems shin tu rnam par grol ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dod chags dang rnam par bral ba'i phyir sems shin tu rnam par grol bas sems shin tu rnam par grol ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Because he is thus free from passion, he is called ‚Äúone whose mind is completely liberated by non-passion.‚Äù

original: ma rig pa dang rnam par bral ba'i phyir shes rab rnam par grol bas shes rab shin tu rnam par grol ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa dang rnam par bral ba'i phyir shes rab rnam par grol bas shes rab shin tu rnam par grol ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Because he is free from ignorance, he is called ‚Äúone whose mind is completely liberated by wisdom.‚Äù

original: de la sred pa'i phyogs kyi nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs pas 'thob par bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa thob pa ni sems rnam par grol ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la sred pa'i phyogs kyi nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs pas 'thob par bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa thob pa ni sems rnam par grol ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The concentration and meditative absorption that he has attained by abandoning the reactive emotions and subsidiary reactive emotions associated with craving are called ‚Äúthe liberation of mind.‚Äù

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pas 'thob par bya ba dgra bcom pa'i lam gyi shes pa ni shes rab rnam par grol ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pas 'thob par bya ba dgra bcom pa'i lam gyi shes pa ni shes rab rnam par grol ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The knowledge of the path of the Worthy One that he has attained by abandoning all reactive patterns is called ‚Äúthe liberation by wisdom.‚Äù

original: de la sems rnam par grol ba thob pas ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol lo //
analyzed: de la sems rnam par grol ba thob pas ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol lo //
translated: By attaining the liberation of mind, he is liberated from the obscurations to meditative absorption.

original: shes rab rnam par grol ba thob pas ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol lo //
analyzed: shes rab rnam par grol ba thob pas ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol lo //
translated: Those who obtain liberation of discernment are liberated from the afflictive obstructions.

original: gnyi ga'i cha las rnam par grol ba dag ni sems shin tu rnam par grol ba dang / shes rab shin tu rnam par grol ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i cha las rnam par grol ba dag ni sems shin tu rnam par grol ba dang / shes rab shin tu rnam par grol ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Those who are liberated from both are called ‚Äúthose whose minds are liberated through both parts‚Äù and ‚Äúthose whose discernment is liberated through both parts.‚Äù

original: cang shes pa zhes bya ba ni mi 'jigs pa ste /
analyzed: cang shes pa zhes bya ba ni mi 'jigs pa ste /
translated: Those who are called ‚Äúthose who know completely‚Äù are fearless.

original: 'jigs pa med pa'i phyir mdo las cang shes lnga gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: 'jigs pa med pa'i phyir mdo las cang shes lnga gsungs pa ste /
translated: Because they are fearless, five who know completely are mentioned in the sutras.

original: lce 'bab pa la sogs pa'i bag tsha ba 'byung bar dogs pa med pas khyu mchog cang shes dang / 'thab mo'i 'jigs pa med pas glang po che dang / rta cang shes dang / gzhan gyi gnod pa byed pa'i 'jigs pa med pas seng ge @6b cang shes dang /
analyzed: lce 'bab pa la sogs pa'i bag tsha ba 'byung bar dogs pa med pas khyu mchog cang shes dang / 'thab mo'i 'jigs pa med pas glang po che dang / rta cang shes dang / gzhan gyi gnod pa byed pa'i 'jigs pa med pas seng ge @6b cang shes dang /
translated: They are the bull who knows completely, because it is not afraid of the danger of lightning and so on; the elephant who knows completely, because it is not afraid of battle; the horse who knows completely, because it is not afraid of the danger of falling; the lion who knows completely, because it is not afraid of the danger of others harming it;

original: 'chi ba'i 'jigs pa med pas dgra bcom pa cang shes so //
analyzed: 'chi ba'i 'jigs pa med pas dgra bcom pa cang shes so //
translated: and the arhat who knows completely, because it is not afraid of the danger of death.

original: mdor na bag tsha ba rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: mdor na bag tsha ba rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: In brief, there are four kinds of danger:

original: sdug bsngal gyis bag tsha ba dang / 'jigs pas bag tsha ba dang / 'jig rten gyi chos kyis bag tsha ba dang / mi shes pas bag tsha ba'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyis bag tsha ba dang / 'jigs pas bag tsha ba dang / 'jig rten gyi chos kyis bag tsha ba dang / mi shes pas bag tsha ba'o //
translated: anxiety about suffering, anxiety about fear, anxiety about worldly things, and anxiety about ignorance.

original: bag tsha ba de rnams med pas bde ba thob pa dang / mi skrag pa thob pa dang / mi 'jigs pa thob pa dang / dbugs dbyung ba thob pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bag tsha ba de rnams med pas bde ba thob pa dang / mi skrag pa thob pa dang / mi 'jigs pa thob pa dang / dbugs dbyung ba thob pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Because of the absence of these anxieties, one attains happiness, attains fearlessness, attains fearlessness, and attains relief.

original: go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: go rims bzhin no //
translated: in that order.

original: de la mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba rnams med pas mya ngan med pa'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi bag tsha ba med do //
analyzed: de la mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba rnams med pas mya ngan med pa'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi bag tsha ba med do //
translated: There is no anxiety about suffering because there is no sorrow, lamentation, suffering, unhappiness, or perturbation.

original: bdag gis smad pa dang / gzhan gyis smad pa dang / ngan 'gro dang 'tshe ba med pa dang / chad pas gcod pa dang / tshigs su bcad pa med pa dang / 'chi bas 'jigs pa rnams med pas 'jigs pa'i bag tsha ba med do //
analyzed: bdag gis smad pa dang / gzhan gyis smad pa dang / ngan 'gro dang 'tshe ba med pa dang / chad pas gcod pa dang / tshigs su bcad pa med pa dang / 'chi bas 'jigs pa rnams med pas 'jigs pa'i bag tsha ba med do //
translated: There is no anxiety about fear because there is no self-condemnation, no condemnation by others, no fear of lower realms or harm, no fear of punishment, no fear of uncomplimentary remarks, and no fear of death.

original: rnyed pa dang / ma rnyed pa dang / grags pa dang / ma grags pa dang / bstod pa dang / smad pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi gos pa med pas 'jig rten gyi chos kyis bag tshab med do //
analyzed: rnyed pa dang / ma rnyed pa dang / grags pa dang / ma grags pa dang / bstod pa dang / smad pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi gos pa med pas 'jig rten gyi chos kyis bag tshab med do //
translated: He is not affected by the worldly dharmas of gain and loss, fame and obscurity, praise and blame, pleasure and pain.

original: mi shes pas dang / the tshom gyi shes pa dang / log par shes pa bar du gcod pa rnams med pas mi shes pa'i bag tsha ba med do //
analyzed: mi shes pas dang / the tshom gyi shes pa dang / log par shes pa bar du gcod pa rnams med pas mi shes pa'i bag tsha ba med do //
translated: He is not affected by ignorance, doubt, and wrong knowledge, which are obstacles.

original: de lta bas na bag tsha ba med pa'i phyir cang shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na bag tsha ba med pa'i phyir cang shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, because he is not affected, he is called the one who is not affected.üîΩThe great elephant is a great leader.

original: glang po chen po zhes bya ba ni gtso bo chen po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste kha cig ni rigs pa gsum dang ldan pa /
analyzed: glang po chen po zhes bya ba ni gtso bo chen po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste kha cig ni rigs pa gsum dang ldan pa /
translated: Some have the three kinds of knowledge.

original: kha cig ni so so yang dag par rig pa thob pa /
analyzed: kha cig ni so so yang dag par rig pa thob pa /
translated: Some have attained the four analytical knowledges.

original: kha cig ni mngon par shes pa drug thob po //
analyzed: kha cig ni mngon par shes pa drug thob po //
translated: Some have attained the six superknowledges.

original: kha cig ni shes pa brda sprod pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: kha cig ni shes pa brda sprod pa dang ldan pa /
translated: Some have attained the knowledge of grammar.

original: kha cig ni gnas gcig thob pa dag ste /
analyzed: kha cig ni gnas gcig thob pa dag ste /
translated: Some have attained the one abode.

original: khyad par du 'phags pa thob pa'i chos rnyed pa'i phyir glang po chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: khyad par du 'phags pa thob pa'i chos rnyed pa'i phyir glang po chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: He is called a great elephant because he has attained the Dharma of distinction.

original: bya ba byas pa byed pa byas pa zhes bya ba ni kun tu rdzogs pa nyid du bstan pa ste /
analyzed: bya ba byas pa byed pa byas pa zhes bya ba ni kun tu rdzogs pa nyid du bstan pa ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúhaving done what had to be done, having accomplished what had to be accomplished‚Äù indicates the perfection of his work.

original: bya bar nges pa la ni bya ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bya bar nges pa la ni bya ba zhes bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWhat had to be done‚Äù refers to the certainty of his work.

original: shar la bya ba la ni byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shar la bya ba la ni byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWhat had to be accomplished‚Äù refers to the work that was to be done.

original: de la tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab yongs su rdzogs pas sdug bsngal thams cad las rnam par thar pa ni las kyi gtso bo ste /
analyzed: de la tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab yongs su rdzogs pas sdug bsngal thams cad las rnam par thar pa ni las kyi gtso bo ste /
translated: Therein, the foremost of his works was the liberation of all beings from all suffering through the perfection of morality, concentration, and wisdom.

original: de dag yongs su rdzogs pas bya ba byas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag yongs su rdzogs pas bya ba byas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because of the perfection of those [three], it is said that he ‚Äúhad done what had to be done, having accomplished what had to be accomplished.‚Äù

original: @7a * // 'dod pa chung bas 'tsho ba dang / chog shes pas 'tsho ba dang / sbyangs pa'i yan lag gis 'tsho ba dang / yang dag par mgu bar byed pas 'tsho ba la sogs pas 'tsho ba'i bye brag rnams yongs su rdzogs par bya ba ni rang dga' dang 'brel ba'i phyir byed pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: @7a * // 'dod pa chung bas 'tsho ba dang / chog shes pas 'tsho ba dang / sbyangs pa'i yan lag gis 'tsho ba dang / yang dag par mgu bar byed pas 'tsho ba la sogs pas 'tsho ba'i bye brag rnams yongs su rdzogs par bya ba ni rang dga' dang 'brel ba'i phyir byed pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The various kinds of livelihood, such as livelihood by having few desires, by being content, by having the ascetic practices, by being satisfied with what is obtained without effort, are fulfilled by the bodhisattva because of his freedom.

original: de yongs su rdzogs pas byed pa byas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de yongs su rdzogs pas byed pa byas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because of the fulfillment of that, he is said to have fulfilled his duty.

original: de bas na bya ba byas pa /
analyzed: de bas na bya ba byas pa /
translated: Therefore, he has fulfilled his duty.

original: byed pa byas pa zhes bya bas ni bsgrub pa'i rnam pa thams cad kun tu rdzogs pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: byed pa byas pa zhes bya bas ni bsgrub pa'i rnam pa thams cad kun tu rdzogs pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: By saying ‚Äúhe has fulfilled his duty‚Äù it is shown that he has completely fulfilled all the aspects of practice.

original: khur bor ba zhes bya ba la /

translated: Here, the bodhisattva, in the midst of an assembly of gods, nagas, yakshas, gandharvas, demigods, garudas, kinnaras, great serpents, disciples, and bodhisattvas, in a circle with a circumference of one hundred leagues,üîΩcauses the sound of his voice to be understood up to a thousand leagues, a thousand times a thousand leagues, a thousand times a thousand times a thousand leagues, and even up to countless, immeasurable world systems in the ten directions.

original: sprul pa gzhan dag gis byed du 'jug par mdzad pa dang / nam mkha' las kyang chos ston pa'i sgra 'byin cing yul sna tshogs na mos pa rnams la bskul bar mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: sprul pa gzhan dag gis byed du 'jug par mdzad pa dang / nam mkha' las kyang chos ston pa'i sgra 'byin cing yul sna tshogs na mos pa rnams la bskul bar mdzad pa'o //
translated: And from those sounds, he causes the Dharma to be taught to beings in many ways, or he causes others to be emanated to do so, and he causes the sound of the Dharma to be heard from the sky, and he causes those who are interested in various objects to be inspired.

original: yul sprul pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: yul sprul pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the emanation object?

original: yo byad kyis phongs pa'i sems can rnams kyi don du byang chub sems dpa' bza' ba dang / btung ba dang / bzhon pa dang / gos dang / nor gu dang / mu tig dang / bee d'u rya la sogs pa'i sprul pa sprul par mdzad de /üîΩji ste de'i tshe tsam zhig tu dgos par gyur na yang de'i tshe tsam nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yo byad kyis phongs pa'i sems can rnams kyi don du byang chub sems dpa' bza' ba dang / btung ba dang / bzhon pa dang / gos dang / nor gu dang / mu tig dang / bee d'u rya la sogs pa'i sprul pa sprul par mdzad de / ji ste de'i tshe tsam zhig tu dgos par gyur na yang de'i tshe tsam nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: For the sake of sentient beings who are in need of material things, the bodhisattva emanates food, drink, vehicles, clothing, pearls, lapis lazuli, and so on.üîΩIf they are needed for just a moment, they last just a moment.

original: ci ste gang gi tshe de bden pa nyid du byin gyis rlob na yang dus ji srid pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ste gang gi tshe de bden pa nyid du byin gyis rlob na yang dus ji srid pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If they are blessed to last, they last as long as they are blessed to last.

original: de ltar rdzu 'phrul bya ba @14b shes pas phan 'dogs so //
analyzed: de ltar rdzu 'phrul bya ba @14b shes pas phan 'dogs so //
translated: Thus, he benefits by means of his magical power.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul gyis sems can rnams 'dun par mdzad nas /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul gyis sems can rnams 'dun par mdzad nas /
translated: Having attracted sentient beings by means of the magical power miracle,

original: sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa la 'jug par mdzad do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa la 'jug par mdzad do //
translated: he causes them to enter the Buddha's teaching.

original: yang na sems can sdug bsngal ba rnam pa sna tshogs kyis phan 'dogs par mdzad pa'o /
analyzed: yang na sems can sdug bsngal ba rnam pa sna tshogs kyis phan 'dogs par mdzad pa'o /
translated: Or else, he benefits those who are suffering by various kinds of relief.

original: // / bam po gnyis pa ;
analyzed: // / bam po gnyis pa ;
translated: The miracle of instruction is the teaching of Dharma by the Buddha, which is superior to all other teachings.

original: / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i shes bzhes pas ni sems can rnams kyi sngon gyi spyod pa rnams rjes su dran nas de dang mthun pa mkhyen te /
analyzed: / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i shes bzhes pas ni sems can rnams kyi sngon gyi spyod pa rnams rjes su dran nas de dang mthun pa mkhyen te /
translated: By means of the knowledge of the recollection of former abodes, he recollects the former practices of beings and knows what is suitable for them.

original: chos bstan pa la sogs pa mdzad do //
analyzed: chos bstan pa la sogs pa mdzad do //
translated: He acts by teaching the Dharma, etc.

original: yang na byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa mchog tu rmad du byung ba'i spyod pa dran nas /
analyzed: yang na byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa mchog tu rmad du byung ba'i spyod pa dran nas /
translated: Or else, recollecting the bodhisattva practices, the most excellent and marvelous practices,

original: sems can rnams dad pa yang dag par bskyed pa'i phyir yang dag par rab tu ston to //
analyzed: sems can rnams dad pa yang dag par bskyed pa'i phyir yang dag par rab tu ston to //
translated: he teaches them correctly in order to generate faith in beings.

original: rtag par smra ba dang / chad par smra ba rnams la sngon gyi tshul nye bar bstan nas /
analyzed: rtag par smra ba dang / chad par smra ba rnams la sngon gyi tshul nye bar bstan nas /
translated: Having taught the former way to the eternalists and nihilists,

original: lta ba rnam par 'jig par byed do //
analyzed: lta ba rnam par 'jig par byed do //
translated: he destroys their views.

original: de shes pa des bdag nyid kyi sngon gyi gnas kyang dran no //üîΩgzhan dag gi sngon gyi srid pa yang dran no //
analyzed: de shes pa des bdag nyid kyi sngon gyi gnas kyang dran no // gzhan dag gi sngon gyi srid pa yang dran no //
translated: By means of that knowledge, he recollects his own former abodes.üîΩHe recollects the former existences of others.

original: yang gzhan dag gi sngon gyi srid pa de dag nyid kyi rjes su dran par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: yang gzhan dag gi sngon gyi srid pa de dag nyid kyi rjes su dran par mdzad pa'o //
translated: He causes others to recollect those very former existences.

original: lha'i rna bas ni sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dvags dang / mi rnams kyi nang du sems can sdug bsngal ba rnams kyi nyam thag pa'i sgra gsan nas /
analyzed: lha'i rna bas ni sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dvags dang / mi rnams kyi nang du sems can sdug bsngal ba rnams kyi nyam thag pa'i sgra gsan nas /
translated: By means of the divine ear, he hears the cries of suffering of beings in the hells, among animals, and in the world of Yama, as well as the voices of beings in the heavens and of humans.

original: de dag gi sdug bsngal bsal ba'i phyir 'bad par mdzad do //üîΩyang na sangs rgyas kyi zhing sna tshogs sam /
analyzed: de dag gi sdug bsngal bsal ba'i phyir 'bad par mdzad do // yang na sangs rgyas kyi zhing sna tshogs sam /
translated: He strives to remove their suffering.

original: 'di nyid na chos bstan pa tha dad pa gang yin pa de dag gsan to //
analyzed: 'di nyid na chos bstan pa tha dad pa gang yin pa de dag gsan to //
translated: Or else, he hears the various teachings of the Dharma in the various buddha-fields.

original: yang na yang dag par bskul ba'i sgra rnam pa du ma gsan to //
analyzed: yang na yang dag par bskul ba'i sgra rnam pa du ma gsan to //
translated: Or else, he hears the various voices of beings who are being exhorted.

original: lha'i mig gis ni byang chub sems dpa' phyogs bcu'i sems can rnams kyi dge ba dang mi dge ba'i spyod pa rnams sna tshogs pa gzigs nas ci rigs par sgrub par mdzad do //
analyzed: lha'i mig gis ni byang chub sems dpa' phyogs bcu'i sems can rnams kyi dge ba dang mi dge ba'i spyod pa rnams sna tshogs pa gzigs nas ci rigs par sgrub par mdzad do //
translated: By means of the divine eye, he sees the various good and evil actions of beings in the ten directions, and he acts appropriately.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dang de dag na de bzhin gshegs pa 'khor mang po'i nang na chos ston pa yang gzigs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dang de dag na de bzhin gshegs pa 'khor mang po'i nang na chos ston pa yang gzigs so //
translated: He sees the Tathagatas teaching the Dharma in their various buddha-fields, surrounded by their various assemblies.

original: pha rol gyi sems shes pas ni gzhan dag gi 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems rnams mkhyen nas /
analyzed: pha rol gyi sems shes pas ni gzhan dag gi 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems rnams mkhyen nas /
translated: By knowing the minds of others, he knows the minds of others that are associated with attachment, hostility, etc.

original: de dag la ci rigs par sgrub par mdzad do //
analyzed: de dag la ci rigs par sgrub par mdzad do //
translated: and he accomplishes them in the appropriate way.

original: sems can rnams kyi dbang po dang / spyod pa dang / khams dang / bag la nyal ba la @15a * //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi dbang po dang / spyod pa dang / khams dang / bag la nyal ba la @15a * //
translated: By knowing the various faculties of sentient beings, their conduct, their natures, their latent propensities, etc.,

original: sogs pa tha dad pa rnams mkhyen nas ci rigs par chos ston to //
analyzed: sogs pa tha dad pa rnams mkhyen nas ci rigs par chos ston to //
translated: he teaches the Dharma in the appropriate way.

original: zag pa shes pas ni byang chub sems dpa' bdag gam gzhan dag gi nyon mongs pa zad pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: zag pa shes pas ni byang chub sems dpa' bdag gam gzhan dag gi nyon mongs pa zad pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: By knowing the extinction of the outflows, the bodhisattva knows, just as it is, the exhaustion of the defilements of himself and others.

original: bdag gi nyon mongs pa zad pa thob pa'am /
analyzed: bdag gi nyon mongs pa zad pa thob pa'am /
translated: He knows, just as it is, whether he has attained the exhaustion of his own defilements

original: ma thob pa'am /
analyzed: ma thob pa'am /
translated: or not,

original: gzhan dag gi nyon mongs pa zad pa thob pa'am /üîΩma thob pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: gzhan dag gi nyon mongs pa zad pa thob pa'am /üîΩma thob pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: and whether others have attained the exhaustion of their defilementsüîΩor not.

original: bdag dang gzhan dag gi nyon mongs pa zag pa zad par bya ba'i thabs dang / thabs ma yin pa yang rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan dag gi nyon mongs pa zag pa zad par bya ba'i thabs dang / thabs ma yin pa yang rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He knows the means and the non-means for the destruction of the defilements of himself and others.

original: gzhan dag gi nyon mongs pa zad pa thob pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang / bden pa yang rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: gzhan dag gi nyon mongs pa zad pa thob pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang / bden pa yang rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He knows the overesteeming of self of others who have attained the destruction of the defilements, and he knows the truth.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de dag thams cad rab tu mkhyen nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de dag thams cad rab tu mkhyen nas /
translated: Having known all those bodhisattvas,

original: de la bdag nyid kyis zag pa zad pa mngon sum du mdzad do //
analyzed: de la bdag nyid kyis zag pa zad pa mngon sum du mdzad do //
translated: he manifests the destruction of the defilements for himself.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po dang / zag pa med pa yang rab tu mkhyen te ;
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po dang / zag pa med pa yang rab tu mkhyen te ;
translated: He knows the things that are associated with the defilements and those that are free from the defilements.

original: / byang chub sems dpa' zag pa zad pa'i shes pa de nyid kyis zag pa dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa'i chos thams cad dang lhan cig gnas kyang bdag nyid kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / byang chub sems dpa' zag pa zad pa'i shes pa de nyid kyis zag pa dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa'i chos thams cad dang lhan cig gnas kyang bdag nyid kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: By that very knowledge of the destruction of the defilements, the bodhisattva does not become defiled himself, even though he dwells together with all the dharmas that are associated with the defilements and that are defiled.

original: mngon par shes pa drug po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' la tshe rabs tshe rabs su yod par gyur to //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa drug po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' la tshe rabs tshe rabs su yod par gyur to //
translated: Those six superknowledges are always present for the bodhisattva in every life.

original: dud 'gro'i skye gnas su skyes pa na yang nyams par mi 'gyur bas na mngon par shes pa mnyams pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dud 'gro'i skye gnas su skyes pa na yang nyams par mi 'gyur bas na mngon par shes pa mnyams pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Even when born in the animal realm, they do not degenerate. Thus, they are called ‚Äúthose whose superknowledges do not degenerate.‚Äù

original: de ltar mngon par shes pa drug dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can rnams la phan gdags pa nyid kyi phyir 'bad do //
analyzed: de ltar mngon par shes pa drug dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can rnams la phan gdags pa nyid kyi phyir 'bad do //
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva who possesses the six superknowledges strives in order to benefit sentient beings.

original: phan gdags pa'i sems can de dag kyang lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' bas byang chub sems dpa'i ngag nyan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: phan gdags pa'i sems can de dag kyang lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' bas byang chub sems dpa'i ngag nyan par 'gyur te /
translated: And those sentient beings who are to be benefited listen to the bodhisattva‚Äôs words with a joy that arises spontaneously.

original: des gdams pa dang / rjes su bstan pa las srog gi phyir yang 'gal bar mi byed do //üîΩgang gzhan yang de la gnod par sems pa dang ldan pa bdud kyi phyogs sam /
analyzed: des gdams pa dang / rjes su bstan pa las srog gi phyir yang 'gal bar mi byed do // gang gzhan yang de la gnod par sems pa dang ldan pa bdud kyi phyogs sam /
translated: They do not transgress the bodhisattva‚Äôs instructions and teachings even at the cost of their lives.üîΩAnd those who are hostile to him, who belong to the faction of MƒÅra,

original: mu stegs can la sogs pa de dag kyang /
analyzed: mu stegs can la sogs pa de dag kyang /
translated: or to the faction of the tƒ´rthikas,

original: thabs kyis bdag gi gdams pa dang / rjes su bstan pa 'dzin du 'jug go //
analyzed: thabs kyis bdag gi gdams pa dang / rjes su bstan pa 'dzin du 'jug go //
translated: he causes to take up his instructions and teachings through skillful means.

original: gang dag de'i ngag nyan du mi btub pa de dag kyang klad pa 'gas pa la sogs pa'i tshor bas bsnyad de /
analyzed: gang dag de'i ngag nyan du mi btub pa de dag kyang klad pa 'gas pa la sogs pa'i tshor bas bsnyad de /
translated: Those who are not able to listen to his speech are threatened with the sensation of their heads splitting open, etc.

original: bsdigs nas bdag @15b gi tshig nyan du 'jug go //
analyzed: bsdigs nas bdag @15b gi tshig nyan du 'jug go //
translated: and are made to listen to my speech.

original: byang chub sems dpa' dus dang dus ma yin pa la sogs pa la gzigs pa ma gtogs par byang chub sems dpa'i ngag las 'gal bar byed pa'i sems can ni sems can gyi ris na gang yang med de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dus dang dus ma yin pa la sogs pa la gzigs pa ma gtogs par byang chub sems dpa'i ngag las 'gal bar byed pa'i sems can ni sems can gyi ris na gang yang med de /
translated: Except for the Bodhisattva, who sees what is timely and untimely, etc., there is no one in the realm of sentient beings who would disobey the speech of the Bodhisattva.

original: 'di ni bsdu ba'i dngos po'i bsod nams yongs su bsngo ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa'i bsod nams kyi stobs kyi chos nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bsdu ba'i dngos po'i bsod nams yongs su bsngo ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa'i bsod nams kyi stobs kyi chos nyid ces bya'o //
translated: This is called the power of the reality of the merit of the means of gathering and the merit of the perfections.

original: de bas na gzung ba'i tshig dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na gzung ba'i tshig dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, he is called one who has words that are accepted.

original: yon tan 'di dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sbyor ba rnam par dag pa yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yon tan 'di dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sbyor ba rnam par dag pa yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the Bodhisattva who has these good qualities is one whose practice is pure,

original: tshul 'chos pa med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: tshul 'chos pa med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he is said to be without hypocrisy, etc.

original: sngar sar chud pa rnams la yang log par 'tsho ba'i las rnams mi srid na khyad par du dri ma med pa'i sa la sogs pa la lta ga la zhig yod /
analyzed: sngar sar chud pa rnams la yang log par 'tsho ba'i las rnams mi srid na khyad par du dri ma med pa'i sa la sogs pa la lta ga la zhig yod /
translated: If it is impossible for those who have entered the levels to have actions that are wrong livelihood, how could they have them on the stainless levels and so on?

original: 'dir sa bdun pa la log par 'tsho ba'i las rnams med bzhin du ci'i phyir bstan zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir sa bdun pa la log par 'tsho ba'i las rnams med bzhin du ci'i phyir bstan zhe na /
translated: Here, one might ask, why is it taught that on the seventh level there are no actions that are wrong livelihood, even though they do not exist?

original: 'di la nyes pa med de /
analyzed: 'di la nyes pa med de /
translated: There is no fault in this,

original: 'og ma rnams su spangs su brin kyang rtsol ba dang bcas pa'i spyod pa 'dir yongs su rdzogs pas tha mar bstan par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'og ma rnams su spangs su brin kyang rtsol ba dang bcas pa'i spyod pa 'dir yongs su rdzogs pas tha mar bstan par bya ba yin no //
translated: because although they are to be abandoned on the lower levels, they are completely perfected here with effortful conduct and so are to be taught in the end.

original: sa bdun pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la ni nyon mongs pa zhes kyang mi bya /
analyzed: sa bdun pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la ni nyon mongs pa zhes kyang mi bya /
translated: For the bodhisattva who is on the seventh level, it is not said that he has defilements,

original: nyon mongs pa med pa zhes kyang mi bya ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa zhes kyang mi bya ste /
translated: nor is it said that he is without defilements.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi spyod pa rnams 'di nyid du shin tu spang ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi spyod pa rnams 'di nyid du shin tu spang ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because he has completely abandoned defiled conduct.

original: 'di ltar lhag pa'i bsam pa yongs su dag pa'i lus kyi las dang ldan pa yin /
analyzed: 'di ltar lhag pa'i bsam pa yongs su dag pa'i lus kyi las dang ldan pa yin /
translated: Thus he is endowed with physical action that is completely pure in its intention.

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa yongs su dag pa'i ngag dang / yid kyi las dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa yongs su dag pa'i ngag dang / yid kyi las dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: He is endowed with the activity of body, speech, and mind that is completely pure in its superior intention.

original: gang dag de bzhin gshegs pas smad pa'i lus dang / ngag dang yid kyi las de dag thams cad kyi thams cad du kun tu mi 'byung ba 'di ni sa bdun pa nyid kyi yon tan te /
analyzed: gang dag de bzhin gshegs pas smad pa'i lus dang / ngag dang yid kyi las de dag thams cad kyi thams cad du kun tu mi 'byung ba 'di ni sa bdun pa nyid kyi yon tan te /
translated: All the actions of body, speech, and mind that are condemned by the Tathagata do not occur in him at all. This is the quality of the seventh stage.

original: de bas na de la log par 'tsho ba'i lus kyi las med par bstan pa'i phyir tshul 'chos pa med pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na de la log par 'tsho ba'i lus kyi las med par bstan pa'i phyir tshul 'chos pa med pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, in order to demonstrate that there is no bodily activity of wrong livelihood on this stage, he says, he is without hypocrisy.

original: rnyed pa 'dod pas ya mtshan du 'dzin du gzhug pa'i phyir gzhan dag la spyod lam du gtogs pa'i lus kyi sbyor ba bstan pa ni tshul 'chos pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa 'dod pas ya mtshan du 'dzin du gzhug pa'i phyir gzhan dag la spyod lam du gtogs pa'i lus kyi sbyor ba bstan pa ni tshul 'chos pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Hypocrisy is the display of bodily activity that is included in one's behavior to others in order to impress them and gain profit.

original: dag gi las yongs su ma dag pa med par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dag gi las yongs su ma dag pa med par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that there is no impure activity of speech, he says,

original: kha gsag med pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: kha gsag med pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: he is without insincerity.

original: rnyed pa dang 'brel pa'i tshig gi sbyor @16a * //
analyzed: rnyed pa dang 'brel pa'i tshig gi sbyor @16a * //
translated: Insincerity is the use of words that are connected with gain.

original: pa rnyed pa 'dod pa nyid kyi phyir smra ba ni kha gsag ces bya'o //üîΩyid kyi las yongs su ma dag pa med par bstan pa'i phyir shes kyi khe dang rnyed pa'i sems med pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /

original: de dag ni shin tu zhi zhing rtsol ba med mod kyi sngon gyi smon lam gyi stobs kyis sems can gyi don spyad pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi spyod pa mngon du 'gyur ro //

analyzed: sa brgyad pa de la mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob par bstan pa'i phyir /

translated: Thus, they are free from the discriminations of the conceptual thoughts of mind, mentation, and consciousness. They are unobstructed,

analyzed: nam mkha' dang 'dra zhing bla gab med pa'i rang bzhin du khong du chud pas mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa zhes bya'o //

translated: The children of the victors, the bodhisattvas who have such acceptance, as soon as they attain the Immovable ground,

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i gnas zab @16b mo shes par dga' ba tha mi dad pa /

analyzed: mtshan ma thams cad dang bral ba thob pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //

translated: Because there is no other profounder state than those profound states of the bodhisattva, he is said to have reached the culmination of patient acceptance of the noncreation of things.

original: de ltar bzod pa thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de ni rgyal rigs dang / bram ze dang / rje'u rigs dang / dmangs rigs dang / lha dang tshangs pa'i 'khor dang / dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / mu stegs can dang bdud kyi 'khor gang dang /

translated: The bodhisattva who has thus attained patient acceptance goes everywhere, to the retinues of the royal class, the priestly class, the merchant class, and the servant class, to the retinues of gods and Brahma, to the retinues of monks, nuns, and non-Buddhists, and to the retinues of Mara.

analyzed: de mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pas chos thams cad skye ba med pa'i rnam par rnam pa thams cad du rtogs pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: rnam par dbye ba ni don so sor yang dag par rig pa'o // ston pa ni nges pa'i tshig so sor yang dag par rig pa'o //

analyzed: ston pa la mkhas pa ni spobs pa so sor yang dag par rig pa'o //

analyzed: de'i phyir chos rab tu rnam par 'byed cing rnam par dbye ba ston pa la mkhas pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //

original: de ltar sa brgyad pa'i yon tan bstan nas //
analyzed: de ltar sa brgyad pa'i yon tan bstan nas //

original: 'dis ci zhig bstan ce na /
analyzed: 'dis ci zhig bstan ce na /

analyzed: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob phan cad gang nang gi gzugs kyi lus de ni thams cad kyi thams cad du snang bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: From the time that they have attained the acceptance that phenomena are not produced, the bodhisattvas no longer have any appearance of the internal body.

original: ming gi tshogs kyang sems pa dang / yid dang rnam par shes pa'i rnam par mi 'jug ste /
analyzed: ming gi tshogs kyang sems pa dang / yid dang rnam par shes pa'i rnam par mi 'jug ste /
translated: The collection of names does not engage in the activities of mind, thought, or consciousness.

original: stong pa'i rnam pa nyid du yang dag par gnas so //
analyzed: stong pa'i rnam pa nyid du yang dag par gnas so //
translated: They abide in the form of emptiness.

original: phyi'i chos khams gsum pa gang dag yin pa de dag kyang thams cad kyi thams cad du snang bar mi 'gyur to //
analyzed: phyi'i chos khams gsum pa gang dag yin pa de dag kyang thams cad kyi thams cad du snang bar mi 'gyur to //
translated: The external elements of the three realms do not appear at all.

original: mtshan ma med pa'i dbyings rnam par thar pa nyid du'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i dbyings rnam par thar pa nyid du'o //
translated: The sphere of signlessness is liberation.

original: de ltar de bzhin nyid tsam du zad par gnas pa de la /
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin nyid tsam du zad par gnas pa de la /
translated: In this way, they abide in suchness alone.

original: rtsol ba thams cad dang / g-yo ba dang / rlom sems dang / spos pa thams cad 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //üîΩsems dpa' chen po de de ltar shin tu yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa dang dngos @18a * //
analyzed: rtsol ba thams cad dang / g-yo ba dang / rlom sems dang / spos pa thams cad 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro // sems dpa' chen po de de ltar shin tu yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa dang dngos @18a * //
translated: All effort, movement, conceit, and all exertion will not occur.

original: po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / gzod ma nas zhi ba dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid du gnas na phyis sangs rgyas su byed pa'i chos rnams dang / sems can gyi don gang yin pa de dag yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / gzod ma nas zhi ba dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid du gnas na phyis sangs rgyas su byed pa'i chos rnams dang / sems can gyi don gang yin pa de dag yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúIf the great being, in that way, abides in the nature of the thoroughly established, the non-existent, the nature of peace from the beginning, and the nature of the realm of phenomena, then later, the qualities that make one a buddha and the benefit of sentient beings will be lost.‚Äù

original: de yongs su mi nyams par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de yongs su mi nyams par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to prevent that loss,

original: bskal pa grangs med pa gnyis su yongs su rdzogs par byas pa'i smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa thabs mkhas pa dang bcas pa snying rje'i rgyu mthun par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: bskal pa grangs med pa gnyis su yongs su rdzogs par byas pa'i smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa thabs mkhas pa dang bcas pa snying rje'i rgyu mthun par 'gyur bas /
translated: the perfection of aspiration, which is completed in two incalculable aeons, together with skillful means, is the cause of compassion.

original: de'i tshe rnam par smin par yongs su bsgyur na /
analyzed: de'i tshe rnam par smin par yongs su bsgyur na /
translated: When it is transformed into the fully ripened,

original: byang chub sems dpa' de yang kun rdzob la 'jug ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de yang kun rdzob la 'jug ste /
translated: And that bodhisattva also engages in the conventional.

original: kun rdzob la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la nang dang phyi'i 'jig rten thams cad sngon gyi dus bzhin du yang dmigs par 'gyur la /
analyzed: kun rdzob la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la nang dang phyi'i 'jig rten thams cad sngon gyi dus bzhin du yang dmigs par 'gyur la /
translated: For the bodhisattva who engages in the conventional, the entire inner and outer world is perceived as it was in the past.

original: de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' de spyod pa la sbyor ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' de spyod pa la sbyor ro //
translated: At that time, that bodhisattva applies himself to practice.

original: de lta na sa 'di la nyon mongs pa kun tu 'byung ba thams cad med pas phyi ma la skye ba gzhan 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i las bsags pa med la /
analyzed: de lta na sa 'di la nyon mongs pa kun tu 'byung ba thams cad med pas phyi ma la skye ba gzhan 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i las bsags pa med la /
translated: Thus, since on this ground all the occurrences of afflictions are absent, there is no accumulation of karma that would lead to rebirth in the future.

original: sngon gyi dus na bsags pa'i las rnams ni /
analyzed: sngon gyi dus na bsags pa'i las rnams ni /
translated: And the karmas accumulated in the past

original: dgra bcom pa rnams kyi bzhin du mthu zad par gyur na /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa rnams kyi bzhin du mthu zad par gyur na /
translated: are exhausted, like those of the arhats.

original: de la las med pas rnam par smin pa yang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: de la las med pas rnam par smin pa yang mi dmigs na /
translated: Since there is no karma for him, there is no ripening either.

original: yang skye ba gzhan len pa lta ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: yang skye ba gzhan len pa lta ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: How then could he take another rebirth?

original: gong du shin tu myur bar ma brtsal du zin kyang gdon mi za bar bskal pa grangs med pa gcig gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa thob par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gong du shin tu myur bar ma brtsal du zin kyang gdon mi za bar bskal pa grangs med pa gcig gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa thob par 'gyur na /
translated: Even if one does not strive to attain the ground of a tathagata in the above manner, one will definitely attain it in one incalculable eon.

original: dus de srid kyi bar du de ji ltar gang gi bdag nyid du gnas par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: dus de srid kyi bar du de ji ltar gang gi bdag nyid du gnas par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does one remain in that state for that length of time?

original: 'di la nyes pa med de /
analyzed: 'di la nyes pa med de /
translated: There is no fault here.

original: 'dir bstan bcos mdzad pa dag gis bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bstan bcos mdzad pa dag gis bshad pa /
translated: The author of the treatise explains:

original: sngon bskal pa grangs med pa gnyis kyi bar du pha rol tu phyin pa gang dag yongs su rdzogs par mdzad de /
analyzed: sngon bskal pa grangs med pa gnyis kyi bar du pha rol tu phyin pa gang dag yongs su rdzogs par mdzad de /
translated: In the past, for two incalculable eons, he completed the perfections.

original: sngon thabs mkhas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas mi zad pa'i rnam par yang dag par bsgrubs shing smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pas sems can la phan gdags pa'i don dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos pa de dag thams cad byang chub sems dpas bzod pa thob pa phan cad rnam par smin pa'i bdag nyid du yongs su bsgyur te /üîΩde ltar rnam par smin par gyur pa de dag gis 'khor ba ji srid par /
analyzed: sngon thabs mkhas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas mi zad pa'i rnam par yang dag par bsgrubs shing smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pas sems can la phan gdags pa'i don dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos pa de dag thams cad byang chub sems dpas bzod pa thob pa phan cad rnam par smin pa'i bdag nyid du yongs su bsgyur te / de ltar rnam par smin par gyur pa de dag gis 'khor ba ji srid par /
translated: All those roots of virtue that the bodhisattva previously fully accomplished with the perfection of skillful means, and dedicated to perfect complete enlightenment for the benefit of beings with the perfection of vows, the bodhisattva transforms into the nature of ripening once he attains forbearance.

original: byang chub sems dpa' lhun gyis grub @18b par sems can gyi don dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bsgrub po //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' lhun gyis grub @18b par sems can gyi don dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bsgrub po //
translated: By those very ripened [roots of virtue], for as long as cyclic existence lasts, the bodhisattva spontaneously accomplishes the benefit of beings and the attainment of perfect complete enlightenment.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par smin pa'i bdag nyid du yongs su gyur pa de dag nyid kyis skye ba gzhan len par byed do //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par smin pa'i bdag nyid du yongs su gyur pa de dag nyid kyis skye ba gzhan len par byed do //
translated: He takes up other births with those very roots of virtue that have been transformed into the nature of ripening.

original: de yang dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par smin pa de dag nyid kyis skyes pa'i rabs rnam pa du ma nye bar bstan te /
analyzed: de yang dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par smin pa de dag nyid kyis skyes pa'i rabs rnam pa du ma nye bar bstan te /
translated: Moreover, by the maturation of those roots of virtue, he displays many kinds of births,

original: sprul pa shin tu mang po rnam pa sna tshogs kyis sems can gyi don mdzad nas sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams yongs su smin par mdzad de /
analyzed: sprul pa shin tu mang po rnam pa sna tshogs kyis sems can gyi don mdzad nas sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams yongs su smin par mdzad de /
translated: and by means of many kinds of emanations, he accomplishes the aims of beings and brings them to maturity in the qualities of a Buddha.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa 'thob po zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa 'thob po zhes bshad do //
translated: He attains the stage of a TathƒÅgata.

original: de bas na spyod pa 'di ni nges pas spyod pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de bas na spyod pa 'di ni nges pas spyod pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Thus, this practice is called the practice of certainty,

original: smon lam gyi mthus mngon par grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smon lam gyi mthus mngon par grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is accomplished by the power of vows.

original: spyod pa gnyis pa ni sems can gyi don du nges pa yin te /
analyzed: spyod pa gnyis pa ni sems can gyi don du nges pa yin te /
translated: The second practice is certain for the sake of beings,

original: rnam par smin pa'i bdag nyid yin pas de'i 'jug pa don med pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i bdag nyid yin pas de'i 'jug pa don med pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is of the nature of maturation, and its engagement is not purposeless.

original: spyod pa 'dis sems can yongs su smin par byas pa'i sems can rnams ni /
analyzed: spyod pa 'dis sems can yongs su smin par byas pa'i sems can rnams ni /
translated: Beings who are brought to maturity by this practice

original: theg pa gsum la nges par 'gyur te /
analyzed: theg pa gsum la nges par 'gyur te /
translated: are certain to enter the three vehicles.

original: de bas na nges par spyod pa la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' nyi ma gcig rangs par /üîΩsems can gyi don byas pa la sngon gyi spyod pa thams cad kyis brgya'i char yang mi phod /
analyzed: de bas na nges par spyod pa la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' nyi ma gcig rangs par / sems can gyi don byas pa la sngon gyi spyod pa thams cad kyis brgya'i char yang mi phod /
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattva who definitely engages in conduct,üîΩeven if he benefits sentient beings for a single day,üîΩis not surpassed by all the previous practices, even by a hundredth part,

original: stong gi char yang mi phod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: stong gi char yang mi phod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: even by a thousandth part.

original: de ltar smon lam gyi mthus yang dag par grub pa'i phyir bskal pa grangs med pa nas smin lam gyis shin tu brtsams pa zhes bya ba gsung so //
analyzed: de ltar smon lam gyi mthus yang dag par grub pa'i phyir bskal pa grangs med pa nas smin lam gyis shin tu brtsams pa zhes bya ba gsung so //
translated: Thus, because of the power of the vow, it is said that he is well-established from beginningless eons, and it is said that he is well-endowed.

original: de ltar shin tu brtsams pa ni sems can rnams la tshad med pas gnas pa'i rgyu mthun pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing du gshegs pa dag gis mngon par shes pa la gnas pa'i rgyu mthun pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa mdo gzhan dag las rgyu mthun pa'i yon tan bstan pa rnams ston te /
analyzed: de ltar shin tu brtsams pa ni sems can rnams la tshad med pas gnas pa'i rgyu mthun pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing du gshegs pa dag gis mngon par shes pa la gnas pa'i rgyu mthun pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa mdo gzhan dag las rgyu mthun pa'i yon tan bstan pa rnams ston te /
translated: Thus, being well-endowed, he is said to be the cause of abiding in immeasurable sentient beings, and the cause of abiding in the superknowledges through going to the buddha-fields, and so on. In other sutras, the qualities of the cause are taught.

original: de la byams pa'i rgyu mthun pa ni /
analyzed: de la byams pa'i rgyu mthun pa ni /
translated: Among them, the cause of love is

original: bzhin 'dzum pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bzhin 'dzum pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: He is called ‚Äúone who has a smiling face.‚Äù

original: 'di ni nges par spyod pa la zhugs pa rnams kyi chos nyid de tshe rabs tshe rabs su bzhin 'dzum pa dang ldan pa nyid du 'gyur ro /
analyzed: 'di ni nges par spyod pa la zhugs pa rnams kyi chos nyid de tshe rabs tshe rabs su bzhin 'dzum pa dang ldan pa nyid du 'gyur ro /
translated: This is the nature of those who have definitely entered the practice: in lifetime after lifetime, they become ones who have a smiling face.

original: 'di lta ste sems can mi bsrun pa rnams dga' zhing yid rton par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di lta ste sems can mi bsrun pa rnams dga' zhing yid rton par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: For example, in order to make unruly sentient beings happy and trusting,

original: gnas skabs thams cad du nam yang bzhin 'gyur ba mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gnas skabs thams cad du nam yang bzhin 'gyur ba mi 'byung ngo //
translated: they never show a frown on their face at any time.

original: snying rje'i rgyu mthun pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: snying rje'i rgyu mthun pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To show the cause of compassion,

original: gsong por smra ba zhes bya ba gsungs @19a * //
analyzed: gsong por smra ba zhes bya ba gsungs @19a * //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúHe is one who speaks pleasantly.‚Äù

original: so // byang chub sems dpa' ni glo bur du 'ongs pa ma 'dris pa la yang bdag nyid kyis kun dga' ba'i gtam gyis bsdu ba sngar ston gyi phyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: so // byang chub sems dpa' ni glo bur du 'ongs pa ma 'dris pa la yang bdag nyid kyis kun dga' ba'i gtam gyis bsdu ba sngar ston gyi phyis ni ma yin no //
translated: The bodhisattva first shows the pleasant conversation that gathers to himself even a stranger who has just arrived, not later.

original: rab tu dga' ba'i rgyu mthun pa bstan pa'i phyir bzhin khro gnyer med pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba'i rgyu mthun pa bstan pa'i phyir bzhin khro gnyer med pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: To show the cause of joy, he says, ‚ÄúHe is one who has a face without frowns.‚Äù

original: 'di ni chos nyid de gang gi bzhin khro gnyer can du 'gyur ba de lta bu'i yid mi bde ba med do //
analyzed: 'di ni chos nyid de gang gi bzhin khro gnyer can du 'gyur ba de lta bu'i yid mi bde ba med do //
translated: This is the nature of things. There is no such mental dissatisfaction that would make him frown.

original: brtson 'grus brtsams pa la skyo bar 'gyur ba de lta bu med do //
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsams pa la skyo bar 'gyur ba de lta bu med do //
translated: There is no such weariness that would come from undertaking effort.

original: gzhan dag la mi bzod par 'gyur ba de lta bu med do //
analyzed: gzhan dag la mi bzod par 'gyur ba de lta bu med do //
translated: There is no such impatience with others.

original: de lta bu'i yid 'khrug pa mi skyed do //
analyzed: de lta bu'i yid 'khrug pa mi skyed do //
translated: He does not arouse such mental agitation.

original: da ni pha rol la tshig su bcad pa'i dbyangs kyis brjod pa la mkhas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du gshegs pa dag gis mngon par shes pa'i rgyu mthun pa'i yon tan rnams ston te /üîΩbyang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi zhing du gshegs pa na lam gyi bar du bdag nyid dam /
analyzed: da ni pha rol la tshig su bcad pa'i dbyangs kyis brjod pa la mkhas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du gshegs pa dag gis mngon par shes pa'i rgyu mthun pa'i yon tan rnams ston te / byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi zhing du gshegs pa na lam gyi bar du bdag nyid dam /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the qualities that are the natural outcome of the higher knowledge of those who have gone to the Buddha-field, he says, Skilled in the melody of speech, etc.

original: sprul pas tshigs su bcad pa'i dbyangs kyis gzhan dag la chos ston cing yang dag par bskul lo //
analyzed: sprul pas tshigs su bcad pa'i dbyangs kyis gzhan dag la chos ston cing yang dag par bskul lo //
translated: When the Bodhisattva goes to the Buddha-field, he teaches the Dharma to others and encourages them, either by himself or through emanations, with the melody of verses along the way.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i drung du byon nas kyang tshigs su bcad pa'i dbyangs kyis bstod pa dang / dris pa'i lan ldon te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i drung du byon nas kyang tshigs su bcad pa'i dbyangs kyis bstod pa dang / dris pa'i lan ldon te /
translated: And having approached the Tathagatas, he praises them with the melody of verses and answers their questions.

original: 'dis ni ngag rnam par dag pa thob par ston to //
analyzed: 'dis ni ngag rnam par dag pa thob par ston to //
translated: This shows the attainment of pure speech.

original: sems rnam par dag pa thob par bstan pa'i phyir sems zhum pa med pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: sems rnam par dag pa thob par bstan pa'i phyir sems zhum pa med pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: In order to show the attainment of pure thought, he says, ‚Äúwithout a depressed mind.‚Äù

original: sa 'og ma la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' kha cig ni tshogs yongs su ma rdzogs pa dang / yid la byed pa rtog pa dang bcas pa'i phyir yon tan gyi lag pas gong ma la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi spyan sngar zhum pa'i sems skye'i 'di dag ni tshe la dbang ba dang /
analyzed: sa 'og ma la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' kha cig ni tshogs yongs su ma rdzogs pa dang / yid la byed pa rtog pa dang bcas pa'i phyir yon tan gyi lag pas gong ma la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi spyan sngar zhum pa'i sems skye'i 'di dag ni tshe la dbang ba dang /
translated: Some bodhisattvas dwelling on lower stages, because their collections are incomplete and their attention is conceptual, have a depressed mind in the presence of bodhisattvas dwelling on higher stages and of the Tathagatas, thinking, ‚ÄúI am not like them.‚Äù

original: sems la dbang ba dang / yo byad la dbang ba dang / las la dbang ba dang / skye ba la dbang ba dang / smon lam la dbang ba dang / mos pa la dbang ba dang / rdzu 'phrul la dbang ba dang / ye shes la dbang ba dang /
analyzed: sems la dbang ba dang / yo byad la dbang ba dang / las la dbang ba dang / skye ba la dbang ba dang / smon lam la dbang ba dang / mos pa la dbang ba dang / rdzu 'phrul la dbang ba dang / ye shes la dbang ba dang /
translated: The ten powers are the power of mind, the power of resources, the power of karma, the power of birth, the power of aspiration, the power of interest, the power of miracles, the power of wisdom,üîΩthe power of Dharma, and the power of complete purity.

original: chos la dbang ba dang / shin tu yongs su dag pa'i dbang bcu po de rnams thob pas dus thams cad du sems la zhum pa'i sems med par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos la dbang ba dang / shin tu yongs su dag pa'i dbang bcu po de rnams thob pas dus thams cad du sems la zhum pa'i sems med par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that one is always free from a depressed mind due to attaining these ten powers,

original: sems zhum pa med pa zhes bya ba @19b gsungs so //
analyzed: sems zhum pa med pa zhes bya ba @19b gsungs so //
translated: it says, without a depressed mind.

original: yang dag par rig pa rnams kyi rnam par smin pa'i so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi thob par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang dag par rig pa rnams kyi rnam par smin pa'i so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi thob par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the attainment of the four correct knowledges that are the fully ripened effects of the correct knowledges,

original: spobs pa mi chod pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: spobs pa mi chod pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: it says, uninterrupted eloquence.

original: de bas na 'di ni chos smra ba chen po yin par brjod de /
analyzed: de bas na 'di ni chos smra ba chen po yin par brjod de /
translated: Therefore, this is called the great Dharma teacher.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa blo gros legs pa zhes bya ba 'di la gnas pa de ni chos smra ba chen po byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa blo gros legs pa zhes bya ba 'di la gnas pa de ni chos smra ba chen po byed do //
translated: The bodhisattva who is on this bodhisattva bh≈´mi called Perfect Understanding is a great Dharma teacher.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi mdzod kyang srung ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi mdzod kyang srung ngo //
translated: He is a protector of the treasure of the Dharma of the TathƒÅgatas.

original: chos smra ba'i go 'phang thob pa de ye shes la mkhas pa tshad med pa dang ldan pas so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi po dag gis mngon bar bsgrubs pa'i tshig gis chos ston te /
analyzed: chos smra ba'i go 'phang thob pa de ye shes la mkhas pa tshad med pa dang ldan pas so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi po dag gis mngon bar bsgrubs pa'i tshig gis chos ston te /
translated: Having attained the status of a Dharma teacher, he teaches the Dharma with words that are accomplished by means of the four analytical knowledges, possessing immeasurable skill in wisdom.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i so so yang dag par rig pa ma 'dres pa bzhi rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par 'byung ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i so so yang dag par rig pa ma 'dres pa bzhi rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par 'byung ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: There, the four unmixed analytical knowledges of the bodhisattva always and uninterruptedly arise.

original: dbyangs kyi yan lag grangs med pa 'bum phrag bcu dang ldan pa la mkhas pa dang / spobs pa'i rnam par dbye ba'i sgo tshad med pa dang ldan pa'i bar gyis chos ston to zhes kyang gsungs te /
analyzed: dbyangs kyi yan lag grangs med pa 'bum phrag bcu dang ldan pa la mkhas pa dang / spobs pa'i rnam par dbye ba'i sgo tshad med pa dang ldan pa'i bar gyis chos ston to zhes kyang gsungs te /
translated: He teaches the Dharma with skill in ten hundred thousand innumerable branches of melody, up to possessing immeasurable doors of discrimination of eloquence.
