translated: The bodhisattva who is skilled in these twenty kinds of expertise will be fearless in any assembly he enters.

original: seng ge dang / tshangs pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dang / nam mkha' bzhin du 'jigs pa med pa dang / bsnyems pa dang bcas pa dang / khyu mchog tu gyur pa dang / gang du yang chags pa med pa dang bdun du byas te 'gro bar 'gyur ro //üîΩde la sus kyang zil gyis mi non la /
analyzed: seng ge dang / tshangs pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dang / nam mkha' bzhin du 'jigs pa med pa dang / bsnyems pa dang bcas pa dang / khyu mchog tu gyur pa dang / gang du yang chags pa med pa dang bdun du byas te 'gro bar 'gyur ro // de la sus kyang zil gyis mi non la /
translated: He will be like a lion, like Brahma, like the Tathagata, and like space. He will be fearless, confident, and the best, and he will not be attached to anything.üîΩNo one can overpower him.

original: bdag gis ni gang yang zil gyis mi non pa med de /
analyzed: bdag gis ni gang yang zil gyis mi non pa med de /
translated: He will not be overpowered by anyone.

original: de'i phyir 'khor mtha' yas pa zil gyis non pa'i mi 'jigs pa dang ldan pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'khor mtha' yas pa zil gyis non pa'i mi 'jigs pa dang ldan pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, he is said to have the fearlessness of overwhelming infinite retinues.

original: bskal pa bye ba mtha' yas pas nges par 'byung ba la mkhas pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni rnam par smin pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rgyu mthun pa bstan te /
analyzed: bskal pa bye ba mtha' yas pas nges par 'byung ba la mkhas pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni rnam par smin pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rgyu mthun pa bstan te /
translated: He is skilled in the means of deliverance through infinite millions of eons. This shows the concordant result of the perfection of effort that is the nature of evolutionary development.

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' ni rnam par smin pa'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa thob pas bya dka' ba thams cad la bya dka' ba'i 'du shes mi bskyed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' ni rnam par smin pa'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa thob pas bya dka' ba thams cad la bya dka' ba'i 'du shes mi bskyed do //
translated: Thus, because the bodhisattva has attained the perfection of effort that is the nature of evolutionary development, he does not develop the idea that anything is difficult to do, even though it is difficult.

original: sems can la phan pa bya ba dag la yongs su gdung ba mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sems can la phan pa bya ba dag la yongs su gdung ba mi 'byung ngo //
translated: He does not become exhausted in working for the welfare of sentient beings.

original: de brtson 'grus shin tu cher brtsams pas 'bad pa na /üîΩbskal pa mang po yang 'da' bar 'gyur ba nas /
analyzed: de brtson 'grus shin tu cher brtsams pas 'bad pa na / bskal pa mang po yang 'da' bar 'gyur ba nas /
translated: When he undertakes great effort,üîΩmany eons pass,

original: bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong gi bar dag kyang 'da' bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong gi bar dag kyang 'da' bar 'gyur te /
translated: up to many quintillions of eons passing.

original: ji skad du bdag cag gi bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa byang chub sems dpar gyur pa na /
analyzed: ji skad du bdag cag gi bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa byang chub sems dpar gyur pa na /
translated: As our Bhagavat Sakyamuni, when he was a bodhisattva,

original: sangs rgyas skar rgyal zhes bya ba mnyes par byed pa na bskal pa dgu 'das par gyur to zhes 'byung ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas skar rgyal zhes bya ba mnyes par byed pa na bskal pa dgu 'das par gyur to zhes 'byung ba lta bu ste /
translated: pleased the Buddha called Pusya, he passed through nine eons.

original: de ltar shin tu brtson pa chen pos 'da' bar byas nas bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong mang po @20b rnams ni 'da' bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de ltar shin tu brtson pa chen pos 'da' bar byas nas bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong mang po @20b rnams ni 'da' bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: In that way, he passed through many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of kotis of eons with great effort.

original: bskal pa grangs med pa las ni sus kyang 'da' bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bskal pa grangs med pa las ni sus kyang 'da' bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But no one can pass through a countless eon.

original: de bas na bskal pa bye ba mtha' yas pas nges par 'byung ba la mkhas pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na bskal pa bye ba mtha' yas pas nges par 'byung ba la mkhas pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said that he is skilled in deliverance through countless niyutas of kotis of eons.

original: de ltar 'di dag gis spyod pa nges pa la sbyor ba'i yon tan bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar 'di dag gis spyod pa nges pa la sbyor ba'i yon tan bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having shown the qualities of application to the certainty of practice,

original: gong du mthar thug par 'gro ba'i sa'i yon tan bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gong du mthar thug par 'gro ba'i sa'i yon tan bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to show the qualities of the stage that leads to the ultimate,üîΩhe says:

original: chos thams cad sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / chu zla dang / rmi lam dang / brag ca dang / mig yor dang / gzugs brnyan dang / sprul pa lta bur khong du chud pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /üîΩ'dis ni rnam par smin pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rgyu mthun par gyur pa /
analyzed: chos thams cad sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / chu zla dang / rmi lam dang / brag ca dang / mig yor dang / gzugs brnyan dang / sprul pa lta bur khong du chud pa zhes bya ba gsungs te / 'dis ni rnam par smin pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rgyu mthun par gyur pa /
translated: He has penetrated all phenomena as being like an illusion, a mirage, a reflection of the moon in water, a dream, an echo, an optical illusion, a reflection, and a magical creation.

original: chos thams cad rnam par 'byed pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin thob par bstan to //
analyzed: chos thams cad rnam par 'byed pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin thob par bstan to //
translated: This shows that he has attained the meditative absorption called ‚Äúthe discernment of all phenomena,‚Äù which is the natural outcome of the perfection of wisdom that is the result of evolution.

original: 'di ltar sgyu ma la sogs pa ni shin tu med kyang dmigs par 'gyur ba ltar chos rnams thams cad kyang de dang 'dra bar rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar sgyu ma la sogs pa ni shin tu med kyang dmigs par 'gyur ba ltar chos rnams thams cad kyang de dang 'dra bar rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he has realized that all phenomena are like illusions and so forth, in that they are not really existent but are still perceived.

original: gdul ba rnams kyi mos pa dang / bsam pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyi phyir la la la gang grags pa'am /
analyzed: gdul ba rnams kyi mos pa dang / bsam pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyi phyir la la la gang grags pa'am /
translated: Because of the various inclinations and intentions of those to be trained, some will understand through a simile that is well known,üîΩwhile others will understand through a simile that is not well known.

original: dogs pa rnam pa brgyad brtsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dogs pa rnam pa brgyad brtsal ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to dispel the eight doubts,

original: dpe rnam pa brgyad bstan te /
analyzed: dpe rnam pa brgyad bstan te /
translated: eight similes are taught.

original: 'di ltar chos rnams med pa yin du zin na /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos rnams med pa yin du zin na /
translated: In this way, if phenomena do not exist,

original: dbyibs la sogs pa'i dbang gis ji ltar dmigs par 'gyur /
analyzed: dbyibs la sogs pa'i dbang gis ji ltar dmigs par 'gyur /
translated: how could they be observed by the power of shape and so on?

original: dmigs su med par chos rnams la dmigs nas sems dang sems las byung ba rnams ji ltar 'byung /
analyzed: dmigs su med par chos rnams la dmigs nas sems dang sems las byung ba rnams ji ltar 'byung /
translated: How could mind and mental factors arise by observing phenomena that cannot be observed?

original: chos rnams yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: chos rnams yod pa ma yin na /
translated: If phenomena do not exist,

original: ji ltar skye ba dang 'jig par snang /
analyzed: ji ltar skye ba dang 'jig par snang /
translated: how could arising and disintegration appear?

original: chos rnams med na ji ltar bza' ba dang / btung ba dang / sbyin pa dang / len pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i tha snyad 'dogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: chos rnams med na ji ltar bza' ba dang / btung ba dang / sbyin pa dang / len pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i tha snyad 'dogs par 'gyur /
translated: If phenomena do not exist, how could conventions such as food and drink, giving and taking, happiness and suffering be designated?

original: ji ltar na ming gi tshogs dang / tshig gi tshogs la sogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar na ming gi tshogs dang / tshig gi tshogs la sogs par 'gyur /
translated: How could there be collections of names, collections of words, and so on?

original: ji ltar na rgyu dang rkyen las 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar na rgyu dang rkyen las 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: How could they arise from causes and conditions?

original: ji ltar na 'bras bu'i chos rnams rgyu dang 'dra bar 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'bras bu'i chos rnams rgyu dang 'dra bar 'gyur /
translated: How could resultant phenomena be similar to their causes?

original: ji ltar na 'gro ba dang 'ong ba la sogs pa'i byed pa 'byung snyam du dogs pa la /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'gro ba dang 'ong ba la sogs pa'i byed pa 'byung snyam du dogs pa la /
translated: How could the activity of coming and going and so on occur?‚Äù

original: chos rnams med na ji ltar dbyibs la sogs pa zhes bya ba 'di la /
analyzed: chos rnams med na ji ltar dbyibs la sogs pa zhes bya ba 'di la /
translated: If phenomena do not exist, how can there be a shape, etc.?

original: sgyu ma'i dpe ste /
analyzed: sgyu ma'i dpe ste /
translated: The example of an illusion is given here.

original: dper na sgyu ma mkhan gyi mis sgyu ma'i glang po che'i tshogs dang / rta'i tshogs dang / shing rta dang / @21a * //
analyzed: dper na sgyu ma mkhan gyi mis sgyu ma'i glang po che'i tshogs dang / rta'i tshogs dang / shing rta dang / @21a * //
translated: For example, a magician displays a group of illusory elephants, a group of illusory horses, chariots,

original: dpung bu chung dang / ri dang / bza' ba dang / btung ba la sogs pa dbyibs kyi dbang gis ston kyang /
analyzed: dpung bu chung dang / ri dang / bza' ba dang / btung ba la sogs pa dbyibs kyi dbang gis ston kyang /
translated: infantry, mountains, food, drink, etc., by the power of shape.

original: de dag dngos su yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag dngos su yod pa ma yin te /
translated: But they do not exist in reality.

original: chos thams cad kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyang de bzhin no //
translated: All phenomena are like that.

original: ji ltar na sems dang sems las byung ba rnams de dag la dmigs nas 'byung bar 'gyur zhe na /üîΩdper na smig rgyu la dmigs nas /
analyzed: ji ltar na sems dang sems las byung ba rnams de dag la dmigs nas 'byung bar 'gyur zhe na / dper na smig rgyu la dmigs nas /
translated: How do mind and mental factors arise in dependence on them?üîΩFor example, the mind and mental factors of sentient beings engage in error by objectifying a mirage.

original: sems can rnams kyi sems dang sems las byung ba phyin ci log tu 'jug pa ltar chos thams cad kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi sems dang sems las byung ba phyin ci log tu 'jug pa ltar chos thams cad kyang de bzhin no //
translated: All phenomena are like that.

original: ji ltar na skye ba dang / 'jig par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na skye ba dang / 'jig par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How can there be origination and destruction?

original: 'di la nyes pa med de /
analyzed: 'di la nyes pa med de /
translated: There is no fault here.

original: chos thams cad la skye ba dang / 'gag pa med pa nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: chos thams cad la skye ba dang / 'gag pa med pa nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: Because all phenomena are non-arising and unceasing.

original: dper na nam mkha' la zla ba snang ba na /
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' la zla ba snang ba na /
translated: For example, when the moon appears in the sky,

original: chu zla yang snang bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: chu zla yang snang bar 'gyur la /
translated: the reflection of the moon appears in the water,

original: mi snang na mi snang bar 'gyur yang /
analyzed: mi snang na mi snang bar 'gyur yang /
translated: and when it does not appear, the reflection of the moon does not appear.

original: dngos po'i bdag nyid du de gang yang med pa de ltar chos thams cad kyang yang dag pa ma yin pa kun brtags pa'i bag chags 'byung na ni snang la /
analyzed: dngos po'i bdag nyid du de gang yang med pa de ltar chos thams cad kyang yang dag pa ma yin pa kun brtags pa'i bag chags 'byung na ni snang la /
translated: But neither of them has any real essence. Likewise, all phenomena appear when the latent tendencies of unreal imagination arise,

original: ma byung na mi snang ba de'i phyir /
analyzed: ma byung na mi snang ba de'i phyir /
translated: and they do not appear when they do not arise.

original: chos thams cad skye ba med cing 'gag pa med do //
analyzed: chos thams cad skye ba med cing 'gag pa med do //
translated: Therefore, all phenomena are non-arising and unceasing.

original: ji ltar 'jig rten gyi tha snyad 'byung bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'jig rten gyi tha snyad 'byung bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How do worldly conventions arise?

original: dper na rmi lam na bza' ba dang / btung ba dang / bgo ba dang / sbyin pa dang / len pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa snang yang don dam par mi dmigs pa ltar tha snyad thams cad kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rmi lam na bza' ba dang / btung ba dang / bgo ba dang / sbyin pa dang / len pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa snang yang don dam par mi dmigs pa ltar tha snyad thams cad kyang de bzhin no //
translated: For example, in a dream, food, drink, clothing, giving, receiving, pleasure, pain, and so on appear, but ultimately they are not observed. All conventions are like that.

original: ji ltar na ming gi tshogs rnams dang / tshig gi tshogs rnams su 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na ming gi tshogs rnams dang / tshig gi tshogs rnams su 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How are there collections of names and collections of phrases?

original: dper na brag ca la sgra'i dngos po med kyang /
analyzed: dper na brag ca la sgra'i dngos po med kyang /
translated: For example, in an echo, there is no real sound,

original: ri dang gcod rong smra ba med pa las sgrar dmigs pa ltar tshig rnams 'jug pa yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: ri dang gcod rong smra ba med pa las sgrar dmigs pa ltar tshig rnams 'jug pa yang de bzhin no //
translated: but a sound is perceived from a mountain or a canyon, even though there is no speaker. The application of words is like that.

original: ji ltar na rgyu dang rkyen rnams las 'byung bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na rgyu dang rkyen rnams las 'byung bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How do they arise from causes and conditions?

original: dper na dbang po nyams pas skra shad 'dzings pa med pa las snang ba dang / yul gyi khyad par las dri za'i grong khyer la sogs pa dang / bsgoms pa'i khyad par gyis zad par la sogs pa'i mtshan mar snang ba dang / 'dod chags dang /
analyzed: dper na dbang po nyams pas skra shad 'dzings pa med pa las snang ba dang / yul gyi khyad par las dri za'i grong khyer la sogs pa dang / bsgoms pa'i khyad par gyis zad par la sogs pa'i mtshan mar snang ba dang / 'dod chags dang /
translated: For example, a person with defective vision sees hairs, a double moon, and so on. A person with healthy eyes does not see these.

original: mya ngan dang / 'jigs pa la sogs pas non pa'i sems kyi rtog pa'i khyad par gyis rnam par brtags pa'i gzugs la sogs pa so sor snang ba'i rgyu las 'byung yang yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du chos thams @21b cad rgyu las 'byung yang yod pa ma yin no
analyzed: mya ngan dang / 'jigs pa la sogs pas non pa'i sems kyi rtog pa'i khyad par gyis rnam par brtags pa'i gzugs la sogs pa so sor snang ba'i rgyu las 'byung yang yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du chos thams @21b cad rgyu las 'byung yang yod pa ma yin no
translated: Likewise, all things arise from causes, but they do not exist.

original: // med du zin na ji ltar pha las bu 'byung ba dang / shing aa mra la sogs pa'i sa bon las 'bras bu 'byung ba bzhin du ji ltar rgyu dang 'dra bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: // med du zin na ji ltar pha las bu 'byung ba dang / shing aa mra la sogs pa'i sa bon las 'bras bu 'byung ba bzhin du ji ltar rgyu dang 'dra bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If they do not exist, how can they be similar to their causes, as in the case of a son arising from his father or a fruit arising from a mango seed?

original: dper na bzhin la sogs pa'i rgyu snang bar 'gyur ba las /
analyzed: dper na bzhin la sogs pa'i rgyu snang bar 'gyur ba las /
translated: For example, a reflection arises from the cause of a face and so on appearing in a mirror and so forth.

original: me long la sogs pa la gzugs brnyan dag 'dra bar dmigs kyang yod pa ma yin pa ltar chos thams cad kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: me long la sogs pa la gzugs brnyan dag 'dra bar dmigs kyang yod pa ma yin pa ltar chos thams cad kyang de bzhin no //
translated: Although it is observed to be similar, it does not exist. All things are like that.

original: ji ltar na byed pa 'byung bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na byed pa 'byung bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How can an effect arise?

original: dper na sprul pa rnams la 'gro ba dang 'ong ba la sogs pa lus kyi las rnams dang / ngag gi las rnams rnam par snang yang de ltar yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du chos thams cad la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: dper na sprul pa rnams la 'gro ba dang 'ong ba la sogs pa lus kyi las rnams dang / ngag gi las rnams rnam par snang yang de ltar yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du chos thams cad la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: For example, just as the actions of the body, such as going and coming, and the actions of speech, appear to exist in the emanations, but do not exist in that way, so it is for all dharmas.

original: yang na mtshan nyid rnam pa brgyad de /
analyzed: yang na mtshan nyid rnam pa brgyad de /
translated: Or else, there are eight characteristics:

original: stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / smon pa med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / ngo bo nyid med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid dang / mig yor gyi mtshan nyid dang /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / smon pa med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / ngo bo nyid med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid dang / mig yor gyi mtshan nyid dang /
translated: the characteristic of emptiness, the characteristic of signlessness, the characteristic of wishlessness, the characteristic of non-production, the characteristic of non-cessation, the characteristic of non-defilement, the characteristic of non-purity, and the characteristic of dependent origination.

original: kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid dang / gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid dang / gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid de /
translated: The characteristic of illusion, the characteristic of the imagined, and the characteristic of the other-dependent.

original: de la sgyu ma'i glang po che la sogs pa med pa ni stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: de la sgyu ma'i glang po che la sogs pa med pa ni stong pa nyid do //
translated: Therein, the elephant, etc. of an illusion, which does not exist, is emptiness.

original: smig rgyu la sogs pa la chu la sogs par nor ba ni mtshan ma med pa'o //
analyzed: smig rgyu la sogs pa la chu la sogs par nor ba ni mtshan ma med pa'o //
translated: The error of water, etc. in a mirage, etc. is signlessness.

original: chu zla ni gang du yang gnas pa med pa ste smon pa med pa'o //
analyzed: chu zla ni gang du yang gnas pa med pa ste smon pa med pa'o //
translated: The reflection of the moon in water is non-existent, i.e. without any substratum.

original: rmi lam ni ngo bo nyid med pa'o //
analyzed: rmi lam ni ngo bo nyid med pa'o //
translated: The dream is without any reality.

original: brag ca ni nam mkha' dang / ri dang / phug la sogs pa'i rkyen las 'byung ba nyid do //
analyzed: brag ca ni nam mkha' dang / ri dang / phug la sogs pa'i rkyen las 'byung ba nyid do //
translated: The echo arises from the conditions of the sky, the mountain, the cave, etc.

original: mig yor ni med pa nyid las snang ba dag go //
analyzed: mig yor ni med pa nyid las snang ba dag go //
translated: The reflected image is the appearance of what is non-existent.

original: gzugs brnyan dag ni bzhin la gnas pa kho na dag yin no //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan dag ni bzhin la gnas pa kho na dag yin no //
translated: The reflection is only the face itself.

original: phyi rol gyi me long la gnas pa ltar snang ba de bzhin du kun brtags pa la yang rnam par shes pa las phyi rol na gnas pa bzhin du snang ngo //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi me long la gnas pa ltar snang ba de bzhin du kun brtags pa la yang rnam par shes pa las phyi rol na gnas pa bzhin du snang ngo //
translated: Just as the reflection appears in the external mirror, so the imagined appears as if it were external to consciousness.

original: gzhan gyi dbang ni rkyen gzhan gyi dbang las 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang ni rkyen gzhan gyi dbang las 'byung ba ste /
translated: The other-dependent is the arising from other conditions.

original: dper na sprul pa dag ni 'phrul byed pa'i dbang gis byung ba bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: dper na sprul pa dag ni 'phrul byed pa'i dbang gis byung ba bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: For example, the magical creation arises from the power of the magician.

original: sems can thams cad kyi sems dang spyod pa dang mos pa dang / phra ba mkhyen pa khong du chud par bya ba la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rgyu mthun pas sems can thams cad kyi sems dang /üîΩspyod pa rjes su rtogs pa zhes bya ba dang / @22a * //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi sems dang spyod pa dang mos pa dang / phra ba mkhyen pa khong du chud par bya ba la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rgyu mthun pas sems can thams cad kyi sems dang / spyod pa rjes su rtogs pa zhes bya ba dang / @22a * //
translated: The cause of the perfection of wisdom is the skill in understanding the subtle knowledge of the minds, conduct, and aspirations of all sentient beings.

original: chos kyi dbyings la 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin skye ste /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings la 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin skye ste /
translated: The result is the arising of the samadhi called the realization of the minds and conduct of all sentient beings and the samadhi called the entry into the dharmadhatu.

original: de la ting nge 'dzin snga mas ni 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na sems can du bsdu bar bsdus pa'i sems can ji snyed yod pa de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus par gyur la /
analyzed: de la ting nge 'dzin snga mas ni 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na sems can du bsdu bar bsdus pa'i sems can ji snyed yod pa de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus par gyur la /
translated: In the former samadhi, all sentient beings included in the realms of sentient beings in all world systems are gathered into one.

original: de dag gi sems dang spyod pa dang mos pa tha dad pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa rnams skad cig gcig la ye shes gcig gis khong du chud de /
analyzed: de dag gi sems dang spyod pa dang mos pa tha dad pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa rnams skad cig gcig la ye shes gcig gis khong du chud de /
translated: In one instant, with one wisdom, the different minds, conduct, and aspirations of those sentient beings are understood.

original: khong du chud nas kyang de dag gdul ba'i thabs skad cig gcig gis khong du chud de /
analyzed: khong du chud nas kyang de dag gdul ba'i thabs skad cig gcig gis khong du chud de /
translated: And having understood them, they also understand the means of training them in a single instant.

original: de dag la de bzhin du sgrub pa yang byed do //
analyzed: de dag la de bzhin du sgrub pa yang byed do //
translated: And they also practice accordingly.

original: gnyis pa chos kyi dbyings la 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pas de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi ye shes phra ba rnam pa du ma la 'jug pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa chos kyi dbyings la 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pas de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi ye shes phra ba rnam pa du ma la 'jug pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Second, through attaining the samadhi of entering the dharmadhatu, they enter the subtle wisdom of the tathagatas, the arhats, the perfectly enlightened buddhas in many ways.

original: spyod pa phra ba la 'jug pa'i mkhyen pa dang / 'chi 'pho dang skye ba phra ba la 'jug pa'i mkhyen pa dang / skye ba phra ba la 'jug pa'i mkhyen pa dang / rnam par 'phrul pa phra ba la 'jug pa'i mkhyen pa dang /
analyzed: spyod pa phra ba la 'jug pa'i mkhyen pa dang / 'chi 'pho dang skye ba phra ba la 'jug pa'i mkhyen pa dang / skye ba phra ba la 'jug pa'i mkhyen pa dang / rnam par 'phrul pa phra ba la 'jug pa'i mkhyen pa dang /
translated: They are: the knowledge of entering subtle conduct, the knowledge of entering subtle death and rebirth, the knowledge of entering subtle birth, the knowledge of entering subtle emanations,

original: mngon par 'byung ba phra ba la 'jug pa'i mkhyen pa dang / mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa phra ba la 'jug pa'i mkhyen pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba phra ba la 'jug pa'i mkhyen pa dang / tshe'i tshad byin gyis rlob pa phra ba la 'jug pa'i mkhyen pa dang /
analyzed: mngon par 'byung ba phra ba la 'jug pa'i mkhyen pa dang / mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa phra ba la 'jug pa'i mkhyen pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba phra ba la 'jug pa'i mkhyen pa dang / tshe'i tshad byin gyis rlob pa phra ba la 'jug pa'i mkhyen pa dang /
translated: the knowledge that penetrates the subtle aspects of going forth, the knowledge that penetrates the subtle aspects of complete enlightenment, the knowledge that penetrates the subtle aspects of turning the wheel of Dharma, the knowledge that penetrates the subtle aspects of blessing life span,

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa phra ba la 'jug pa'i mkhyen pa dang / bstan pa gnas pa phra ba la 'jug pa'i mkhyen pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba phra ba la 'jug pa'i mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa phra ba la 'jug pa'i mkhyen pa dang / bstan pa gnas pa phra ba la 'jug pa'i mkhyen pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba phra ba la 'jug pa'i mkhyen pa'o //
translated: the knowledge that penetrates the subtle aspects of parinirvƒÅ·πáa, the knowledge that penetrates the subtle aspects of the duration of the teachings, and the knowledge that penetrates the subtle aspects of the tathƒÅgatas‚Äô secrets.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba ni 'di yin te /
translated: This is the secret of the tathƒÅgatas.

original: sgu'i gsang ba dang / gsung gi gsang ba dang / thugs kyi gsang ba dang / dus dang dus ma yin pa rnam par dpyad pa gsang ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' lung bstan pa gsang ba dang / sems can bsdu ba dang tshar bcad pa gsang ba dang /üîΩtheg pa tha dad pa gsang ba dang / sems can gyi spyod pa dang dbang po rnam par dbye ba gsang ba dang / las su bya ba la 'jug pa gsang ba dang / spyod pa dang mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa gsang ba dang /
analyzed: sgu'i gsang ba dang / gsung gi gsang ba dang / thugs kyi gsang ba dang / dus dang dus ma yin pa rnam par dpyad pa gsang ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' lung bstan pa gsang ba dang / sems can bsdu ba dang tshar bcad pa gsang ba dang / theg pa tha dad pa gsang ba dang / sems can gyi spyod pa dang dbang po rnam par dbye ba gsang ba dang / las su bya ba la 'jug pa gsang ba dang / spyod pa dang mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa gsang ba dang /
translated: the secret of the body, the secret of speech, the secret of mind, the secret of analyzing the timely and untimely, the secret of the bodhisattva‚Äôs prediction, the secret of attracting and subduing sentient beings,üîΩthe secret of the different vehicles, the secret of the classification of sentient beings‚Äô conduct and faculties, the secret of engaging in activities, the secret of conduct and manifest complete enlightenment,

original: rang bzhin @22b thugs su chud pa gsang ba dang / ye shes de gnyis ka gcig tu bsdus nas sems can thams cad kyi sems dang spyod pa dang / mos pa dang phra ba mkhyen pa khong du chud par bya ba la mkhas pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: rang bzhin @22b thugs su chud pa gsang ba dang / ye shes de gnyis ka gcig tu bsdus nas sems can thams cad kyi sems dang spyod pa dang / mos pa dang phra ba mkhyen pa khong du chud par bya ba la mkhas pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: the secret of the realization of the nature, and the secret of the gnosis that combines those two.

original: sems thogs pa med pa zhes bya ba ni stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rgyu mthun pa thob par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: sems thogs pa med pa zhes bya ba ni stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rgyu mthun pa thob par bstan pa ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúhis mind is unimpeded‚Äù shows that he has attained the cause of the perfection of power.

analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par smin pa'i bdag nyid kyi stobs thob pas thams cad la sems thogs pa med par 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, because he has attained the power that is the nature of the result of evolution, his mind is unimpeded with regard to everything.

original: stobs de dag kyang gang zhe na /üîΩnyon mongs pa kun du 'byung ba med pa'i phyir bsam pa'i stobs dang / sa'i ye shes yongs su spyad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: stobs de dag kyang gang zhe na / nyon mongs pa kun du 'byung ba med pa'i phyir bsam pa'i stobs dang / sa'i ye shes yongs su spyad pa'i phyir /
translated: What are those powers?üîΩThe power of intention, because the arising of the afflictions is absent;üîΩthe power of superior intention, because of the practice of the knowledge of the stages;

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa'i stobs dang / brjed ngas pa med pa'i chos can gyi phyir gzungs kyi stobs dang / rtag tu rnam par g-yeng ba med pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs dang / mtha' yas mu med pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi spyod pa rnam par dbye ba la mkhas pa'i phyir mngon bar shes pa'i stobs dang /
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa'i stobs dang / brjed ngas pa med pa'i chos can gyi phyir gzungs kyi stobs dang / rtag tu rnam par g-yeng ba med pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs dang / mtha' yas mu med pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi spyod pa rnam par dbye ba la mkhas pa'i phyir mngon bar shes pa'i stobs dang /
translated: the power of retention, because he is not forgetful; the power of meditative concentration, because he is always undistracted; the power of the superknowledges, because he is skilled in the analysis of the conduct of the infinite and limitless world systems;

original: 'dod pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par thob pa'i phyir dbang gi stobs dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad rab tu rnam par 'byed pa dang rnam par dbye ba la mkhas pa'i phyir spobs pa'i stobs dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi spyod pa la sbyor ba ma btang ba'i phyir smon lam gyi stobs dang /
analyzed: 'dod pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par thob pa'i phyir dbang gi stobs dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad rab tu rnam par 'byed pa dang rnam par dbye ba la mkhas pa'i phyir spobs pa'i stobs dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi spyod pa la sbyor ba ma btang ba'i phyir smon lam gyi stobs dang /
translated: the power of mastery, in order to obtain the fulfillment of all wishes; the power of eloquence, in order to be skilled in discerning and distinguishing all the qualities of the Buddha; the power of aspiration, in order to never give up applying oneself to the conduct of all the qualities of the Buddha;

original: bdag nyid kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad la phan par bya ba'i spyod pa ma btang ba'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa'i stobs dang / sems can thams cad yongs su bskyab pa la brtson pa ma btang ba'i phyir byams pa chen po'i stobs dang /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad la phan par bya ba'i spyod pa ma btang ba'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa'i stobs dang / sems can thams cad yongs su bskyab pa la brtson pa ma btang ba'i phyir byams pa chen po'i stobs dang /
translated: the power of the transcendent perfections, in order to never give up the conduct of bringing one‚Äôs own qualities of the Buddha to maturity, of bringing sentient beings to maturity, and of benefiting all sentient beings; the power of great love, in order to never give up striving to protect all sentient beings;

original: sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal thams cad sel ba'i phyir snying rje chen po'i stobs dang / sgyu ma lta bu la sogs pa'i chos nyid mngon sum du byed pa'i phyir chos nyid kyi stobs dang / rnam pa thams cad du thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes mngon du gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal thams cad sel ba'i phyir snying rje chen po'i stobs dang / sgyu ma lta bu la sogs pa'i chos nyid mngon sum du byed pa'i phyir chos nyid kyi stobs dang / rnam pa thams cad du thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes mngon du gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: The power of great compassion, in order to remove all the sufferings of all sentient beings,üîΩthe power of reality, in order to manifest the reality of illusion-like phenomena, and

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi byin gyi brlabs kyi stobs te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi byin gyi brlabs kyi stobs te /
translated: the power of the blessings of all the tathagatas, in order to manifest the gnosis of omniscience in all aspects.

original: mdo las bshad pa'i stobs de dag nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mdo las bshad pa'i stobs de dag nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: Because he possesses those powers explained in the sutras,

original: thams cad du thogs pa med pa'i chos nyid thob pas @23a * //
analyzed: thams cad du thogs pa med pa'i chos nyid thob pas @23a * //
translated: he has attained the reality that is unobstructed in all ways,

original: na / sems thogs pa med pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: na / sems thogs pa med pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: and therefore he is said to have an unobstructed mind.

original: bzod pa rlabs po che dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni chos kyi sprin zhes bya ba'i sa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes khyad par can du dbang bskur ba dang ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob ma thag tu rin poüîΩche'i rgyal po'i pad ma chen po'i steng du /
analyzed: bzod pa rlabs po che dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni chos kyi sprin zhes bya ba'i sa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes khyad par can du dbang bskur ba dang ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob ma thag tu rin po che'i rgyal po'i pad ma chen po'i steng du /
translated: The bodhisattva who possesses great waves of patience is the bodhisattva abiding on the ground called Cloud of Dharma, who has just obtained the concentration endowed with the special empowerment of the gnosis of omniscience.

original: phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis 'od zer gyi dbang bskur ba thob ma thag tu sngar thob pa'i bzod pa de dag shin tu sbyangs par gyur te /

translated: Immediately upon obtaining the empowerment of light rays from all the tathagatas of the ten directions, the patience previously obtained becomes purified.

translated: He generates patience for the hundreds of thousands of concentrations such as the concentration of the heroic stride and the hundreds of thousands of dhƒÅra·πáƒ´s such as the dhƒÅra·πáƒ´ door called inexhaustible casket and so on and he generates patience for the limitless objects of buddhas.

translated: Because they have arisen, it is said that omniscience is merely a matter of time.

analyzed: bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du 'jug pa la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rgyu mthun pa nyid kyis gzud pa mkhyen pa bcu thob par bstan pa ste /
translated: Skill in engaging in the way things are refers to the ten knowledges of engaging in the way things are that are taught to be the concordant result of the perfection of wisdom.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

analyzed: des de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi gzud pa mkhyen pa gang dag 'di lta ste /

original: byis pa'i lam gzud pa mkhyen pa dang / rdul phra rab kyi rdul gyi gzud pa mkhyen pa dang / zhing gi tshogs mngon par rdzogs par thugs su chud pas gzud pa mkhyen pa dang / sems can gyi tshogs kyi sems mngon par rdzogs par thugs su chud pas gzung pa mkhyen pa dang /
analyzed: byis pa'i lam gzud pa mkhyen pa dang / rdul phra rab kyi rdul gyi gzud pa mkhyen pa dang / zhing gi tshogs mngon par rdzogs par thugs su chud pas gzud pa mkhyen pa dang / sems can gyi tshogs kyi sems mngon par rdzogs par thugs su chud pas gzung pa mkhyen pa dang /

translated: He knows the conduct that is to be known by the ≈õrƒÅvakas, the conduct that is to be known by the pratyekabuddhas, the conduct that is to be known by the bodhisattvas, and the conduct that is to be known by the tathƒÅgatas.

analyzed: bla na med pa thams cad kyi bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du mkhas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

analyzed: smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rgyu mthun par bstan pa'i phyir /

original: de las lhag par bdag gi yang gyur cig ces sngon smon lam btab pa gang yin pa dang / de'i phyir brtson 'grus chen pos 'jug par byas pa gang dag yin pa'i smon lam gyi 'jug pa de dag gis da ltar rnam par smin pa'i bdag nyid du yongs su zin par gyur to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de las lhag par bdag gi yang gyur cig ces sngon smon lam btab pa gang yin pa dang / de'i phyir brtson 'grus chen pos 'jug par byas pa gang dag yin pa'i smon lam gyi 'jug pa de dag gis da ltar rnam par smin pa'i bdag nyid du yongs su zin par gyur to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: And he is fully embraced by the maturation of those aspirations and engagements that he has made through great effort.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med pa na bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa'i ting nge 'dzin rtag tu rgyun mi chad pas mngon du gyur pa zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rgyu mthun pa bstan pa ste /

translated: The concentration of recollection of the buddhas dwelling in the countless world systems is always and uninterruptedly actualized is the teaching of the concordant result of the perfection of meditative concentration.

original: sngon sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa'i ting nge 'dzin bsgoms pa'i dbang gis /
analyzed: sngon sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa'i ting nge 'dzin bsgoms pa'i dbang gis /
translated: Through the power of previously cultivating the concentration of recollection of the buddhas,

original: de ltar 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med grangs med pa'i sangs rgyas de dag thams cad kyi spyan snga na thams cad du thams cad na skad cig tsam yang mi 'bral bar lhun gyis grub pa nyid du mngon du gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

translated: in that way, in the presence of all those buddhas in the immeasurable and countless world systems, one is always and uninterruptedly never separate from them for even a moment, spontaneously actualizing them. This is the meaning of always and uninterruptedly actualized.

original: sangs rgyas dpag tu med pa la gsol ba 'debs pa la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med grangs med pa dag nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang dag bzhugs pa de dag thams cad kyi drung du bzhud nas chos kyi 'khor lo
analyzed: sangs rgyas dpag tu med pa la gsol ba 'debs pa la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med grangs med pa dag nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang dag bzhugs pa de dag thams cad kyi drung du bzhud nas chos kyi 'khor lo
translated: Skill in supplicating immeasurable buddhas means that, having gone into the presence of all the bhagavan buddhas dwelling in the immeasurable, countless world systems, one is skilled in supplicating them to turn the wheel of the dharma,

original: bskor ba dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar bzhed pa @24a * //üîΩrnams yun ring du bzhugs par bya ba'i phyir gsol ba 'debs pa la mkhas pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

original: lta ba dang bag la nyal dang kun nas dkris pa dang nyon mongs pa sna tshogs rab tu zhi bar bya ba la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rgyu mthun pa bstan pa ste /

translated: Having seen the different thoughts, latent propensities, conduct, aspirations, and faculties of sentient beings, he is skilled in pacifying their views, etc., in whatever way is appropriate.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúhe is skilled in the accomplishment of a hundred thousand varieties of play that are based upon states of meditative absorption‚Äù indicates that he has attained mastery over the ripening of his supernatural knowledge.

translated: ‚ÄúAh! When I have attained perfect enlightenment, I will lead all living beings to the ultimate Nirvana!‚Äù

original: byang chub dang sems can la dmigs nas kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis la gnas te shes rab dang snying rje gnyis kyi sems rin po che bskyed pa dang ldan pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub dang sems can la dmigs nas kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis la gnas te shes rab dang snying rje gnyis kyi sems rin po che bskyed pa dang ldan pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
translated: Because they have generated the precious mind of wisdom and compassion, abiding in the two truths, relative and ultimate, with reference to enlightenment and sentient beings, they are called bodhisattvas.

original: rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa sems bskyed pa bcu la don dam pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa sems bskyed pa bcu la don dam pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
translated: On the ten grounds such as Perfect Joy, they are called ultimate bodhisattvas.

original: slob dpon gzhan dag 'chad pa ni @40a * //
analyzed: slob dpon gzhan dag 'chad pa ni @40a * //
translated: Other masters explain:üîΩSince it is said that all sentient beings have the essence of the tathƒÅgata, all sentient beings are classified in terms of suchness.

original: sems can thams cad ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po yin no zhes 'byung bas sems can thams cad ni de bzhin nyid kyis rab tu phye ba yin no de bzhin nyid de la yang gnas skabs gsum yod de /
analyzed: sems can thams cad ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po yin no zhes 'byung bas sems can thams cad ni de bzhin nyid kyis rab tu phye ba yin no de bzhin nyid de la yang gnas skabs gsum yod de /
translated: That suchness has three phases:

original: ma dag pa'i gnas skabs dang / dag pa dang ma dag pa'i gnas skabs dang / shin tu yongs su dag pa'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: ma dag pa'i gnas skabs dang / dag pa dang ma dag pa'i gnas skabs dang / shin tu yongs su dag pa'i gnas skabs so //
translated: the impure phase, the phase of both pure and impure, and the completely pure phase.

original: de la ma dag pa'i gnas skabs ni so so'i skye bo thams cad la byang chub kyi gnas skabs ni med kyi /
analyzed: de la ma dag pa'i gnas skabs ni so so'i skye bo thams cad la byang chub kyi gnas skabs ni med kyi /
translated: The stage of enlightenment is that of the bodhisattvas.üîΩThe stage of purity and impurity is that of the ƒÅryas.

original: sems dpa'i gnas skabs 'ba' zhig tu zad pas ni de bzhin nyid de la sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i ming du brjod do //
analyzed: sems dpa'i gnas skabs 'ba' zhig tu zad pas ni de bzhin nyid de la sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i ming du brjod do //
translated: The stage of complete purity is that of the tathƒÅgatas.üîΩThe stage of impurity is that of all ordinary beings.üîΩThe stage of enlightenment is that of the bodhisattvas.üîΩThe stage of purity and impurity is that of the ƒÅryas.

original: dag pa dang ma dag pa'i gnas skabs kyi 'phags pa rnams la ni byang chub pa'i gnas skabs dang / sems dpa'i gnas skabs gnyis ka yod de dag pa dang ma dag pa'i de bzhin nyid de la byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i ming du brjod do //
analyzed: dag pa dang ma dag pa'i gnas skabs kyi 'phags pa rnams la ni byang chub pa'i gnas skabs dang / sems dpa'i gnas skabs gnyis ka yod de dag pa dang ma dag pa'i de bzhin nyid de la byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i ming du brjod do //
translated: The stage of complete purity is that of the tathƒÅgatas.üîΩThe stage of impurity is that of all ordinary beings.

original: yongs su dag pa'i gnas skabs na ni byang chub kyi gnas skabs 'ba' zhig tu zad pas /
analyzed: yongs su dag pa'i gnas skabs na ni byang chub kyi gnas skabs 'ba' zhig tu zad pas /
translated: The stage of enlightenment is that of the bodhisattvas.üîΩThe stage of purity and impurity is that of the ƒÅryas.

original: de'i tshe de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba'i ming du brjod de /
analyzed: de'i tshe de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba'i ming du brjod de /
translated: The stage of complete purity is that of the tathƒÅgatas.

original: ji skad du rab 'byor de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba de ni yang dag pa de bzhin nyid kyi tshig bla dvags so zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji skad du rab 'byor de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba de ni yang dag pa de bzhin nyid kyi tshig bla dvags so zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: As it is said, ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, the TathƒÅgata is a term for reality just as it is.‚Äù

original: sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu dang mthun pa'i rigs dang / rigs dang mthun pa'i mos pa dang / mos pa dang mthun pa'i bsam pa dang / bsam pa dang mthun pa'i smon lam dang / smon lam dang mthun pa'i spyod pa dang /
analyzed: sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu dang mthun pa'i rigs dang / rigs dang mthun pa'i mos pa dang / mos pa dang mthun pa'i bsam pa dang / bsam pa dang mthun pa'i smon lam dang / smon lam dang mthun pa'i spyod pa dang /
translated: The great being is the family that is consistent with the result, the interest that is consistent with the family, the intention that is consistent with the interest, the prayer that is consistent with the intention, the conduct that is consistent with the prayer,

original: spyod pa dang mthun pa'i brtson 'grus dang / brtson 'grus dang mthun pa'i dus dang / dus dang mthun pa'i tshogs dang / tshogs dang mthun pa'i yang dag par 'grub pa dang yang dag par 'grub pa dang mthun pa'i 'bras bu dang / 'bras bu dang mthun pa'i sems can gyi don dang /
analyzed: spyod pa dang mthun pa'i brtson 'grus dang / brtson 'grus dang mthun pa'i dus dang / dus dang mthun pa'i tshogs dang / tshogs dang mthun pa'i yang dag par 'grub pa dang yang dag par 'grub pa dang mthun pa'i 'bras bu dang / 'bras bu dang mthun pa'i sems can gyi don dang /
translated: the effort that is consistent with the conduct, the time that is consistent with the effort, the accumulation that is consistent with the time, the perfect accomplishment that is consistent with the accumulation, the result that is consistent with the perfect accomplishment, and the benefit to sentient beings that is consistent with the result.

original: chen po rnam pa bcu gcig yod pa 'di dag dang ldan pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chen po rnam pa bcu gcig yod pa 'di dag dang ldan pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: Because he possesses these eleven kinds of greatness, he is called a Bodhisattva-Mahasattva.

original: chos thams cad ces bya ba 'dis ni ji snyed yod pa bstan to //
analyzed: chos thams cad ces bya ba 'dis ni ji snyed yod pa bstan to //
translated: All dharmas indicates the extent of existence.

original: rnam pa thams cad du zhes bya ba 'dis ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa bstan to //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du zhes bya ba 'dis ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa bstan to //
translated: In all aspects indicates the mode of existence.

original: mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par @40b 'dod pa zhes bya bas ni mngon par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la sems pa bstan to //
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par @40b 'dod pa zhes bya bas ni mngon par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la sems pa bstan to //
translated: The desire for full enlightenment indicates the thought of full enlightenment.

original: de la chos thams cad ces bya ba la chos ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la chos thams cad ces bya ba la chos ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: All dharmas are of two kinds:

original: kun brtags pa'i chos rnams dang / yongs su grub pa'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i chos rnams dang / yongs su grub pa'i chos rnams so //
translated: imagined dharmas and accomplished dharmas.

original: rnam pa thams cad du zhes bya ba la rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du zhes bya ba la rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: In all aspects is of two kinds:

original: kun rdzob kyi rnam pa dang / don dam pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi rnam pa dang / don dam pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: conventional aspects and ultimate aspects.

original: mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par 'dod pas zhes bya ba la mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par 'dod pas zhes bya ba la mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Fully awakening to all phenomena is twofold:

original: thams cad shes pa nyid kyi ye shes dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: thams cad shes pa nyid kyi ye shes dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes so //
translated: the wisdom of the knowledge of all phenomena and the wisdom of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de la kun brtags pa'i chos 'jig rten gsum du gtogs pa dang / dus gsum du gtogs pa rnams ni 'jig rten pa'i kun rdzob kyi rnam pa thams cad shes pa nyid kyi ye shes kyis mngon par rdzogs par byang chub po //
analyzed: de la kun brtags pa'i chos 'jig rten gsum du gtogs pa dang / dus gsum du gtogs pa rnams ni 'jig rten pa'i kun rdzob kyi rnam pa thams cad shes pa nyid kyi ye shes kyis mngon par rdzogs par byang chub po //
translated: The imputed phenomena that belong to the three worlds and belong to the three times are fully awakened to by the wisdom of the knowledge of all aspects that is the mundane conventional.

original: yongs su grub pa'i chos rnams ni 'jig rten las 'das pa skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / gzod ma nas zhi ba dang / rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i chos rnams ni 'jig rten las 'das pa skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / gzod ma nas zhi ba dang / rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang /
translated: The fully present phenomena are fully awakened to by the wisdom of the knowledge of all aspects that is the supramundane, which is unborn, unceasing, primordially peaceful, naturally passed beyond sorrow, and the nature of nonentity.

original: stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i rnam par thar pa rnam par thar pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes kyis mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa ste /
analyzed: stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i rnam par thar pa rnam par thar pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes kyis mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa ste /
translated: The liberation of emptiness, etc. is fully awakened to by the knowledge of the liberation of the knowledge of all modes.

original: de bas na rnam pa thams cad du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par 'dod pas zhes bya ba gsungs so //üîΩshes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la zhes bya ba ni de la don dam par smon lam dang / brtson 'grus brtsams pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang / las dang / sdug bsngal dang / 'khor ba dang / rnam par rtog pa dang /
analyzed: de bas na rnam pa thams cad du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par 'dod pas zhes bya ba gsungs so // shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la zhes bya ba ni de la don dam par smon lam dang / brtson 'grus brtsams pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang / las dang / sdug bsngal dang / 'khor ba dang / rnam par rtog pa dang /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúone who wishes to fully awaken to all modes.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúThe perfection of wisdom‚Äù is so called because it goes to the other side of the nine topics, i.e., of the ultimate, of aspiration, of the undertaking of vigor, of the afflictions, of karma, of suffering, of cyclic life, of conceptualization, of the qualities, and of the knowable.

original: yon tan dang / shes par bya ba dang / rnam pa 'di dgu'i pha rol du son pa'i phyir 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes rnam par mi rtog pa'i rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis bsdus pa la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yon tan dang / shes par bya ba dang / rnam pa 'di dgu'i pha rol du son pa'i phyir 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes rnam par mi rtog pa'i rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis bsdus pa la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is included in the supramundane, non-conceptual knowledge, and in the vajra-like concentration.

original: de nas de'i rjes la thob pa rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes me long lta bu dang / mnyam pa nyid dang / so sor rtog pa dang / bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes rnams kyang de'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir 'bras bu la rgyus @41a * //üîΩbtags te / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya bar bstan to //
analyzed: de nas de'i rjes la thob pa rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes me long lta bu dang / mnyam pa nyid dang / so sor rtog pa dang / bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes rnams kyang de'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir 'bras bu la rgyus @41a * // btags te / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya bar bstan to //
translated: Then, the subsequent attainment with conceptual thought and the nonconceptual wisdoms of the mirrorlike, equality, individualizing, and duty-fulfillment wisdoms are also designated by the name of their cause, the perfection of wisdom, because they arise from the cause of the perfection of wisdom.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi mthar phyin pa'i sas bsdus pa dgra bcom pa'i lam gyi ye shes kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rgyu mthun pa yin pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi mthar phyin pa'i sas bsdus pa dgra bcom pa'i lam gyi ye shes kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rgyu mthun pa yin pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: The wisdom of the path of the arhat included in the perfection stage of the sravakas and pratyekabuddhas is also a natural outcome of the perfection of wisdom, so it is designated by the name perfection of wisdom.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mos pas spyod pa'i sa nas nye bar bzung ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mos pas spyod pa'i sa nas nye bar bzung ste /
translated: The bodhisattvas, beginning from the level of earnest aspiration,

original: sa bcu chos kyi sprin gyi bar du mnyan pa dang bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa la sogs pa'i rim pas mngon par 'phel ba chos kyi dbyings dri ma med par byed pa'i thabs kyis zin pa kun tu 'gro ba'i don dang / mchog gi don la sogs par de bzhin nyid la 'jug pa'i khyad par mngon sum du byed pas sa dang sa dag la gnas dag pa'i ye shes je che je cher gyur pas lhag par rtog pa'i khyad par thob par byed pa'i ye shes gang yin pa de
analyzed: sa bcu chos kyi sprin gyi bar du mnyan pa dang bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa la sogs pa'i rim pas mngon par 'phel ba chos kyi dbyings dri ma med par byed pa'i thabs kyis zin pa kun tu 'gro ba'i don dang / mchog gi don la sogs par de bzhin nyid la 'jug pa'i khyad par mngon sum du byed pas sa dang sa dag la gnas dag pa'i ye shes je che je cher gyur pas lhag par rtog pa'i khyad par thob par byed pa'i ye shes gang yin pa de
translated: The wisdom that is obtained by the special actualization of the distinctions of engaging suchness in terms of the meaning of omnipresence and the meaning of the supreme meaning and so on, through the stages of listening, contemplating, and meditating up through the tenth bhumi Cloud of Dharma, which is the method of purifying the stainless dharmadhatu,

original: dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'i ming thob pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'i ming thob pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: is also called the perfection of wisdom.

original: de nyid sgrub pa dang / rtogs pa dang / mthar phyin pa'i sa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'i tshig gi don ma lus pa'i khyad par rtogs par byed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid sgrub pa dang / rtogs pa dang / mthar phyin pa'i sa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'i tshig gi don ma lus pa'i khyad par rtogs par byed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is the cause for realizing the distinctions of all the meanings of the words of abiding in the samadhi of the bhumi of accomplishing, realizing, and perfecting,

original: ming gi tshogs dang / tshig gi tshogs dang / yi ge'i tshogs su gyur pa'i chos bstan pa gang yin pa de dag la yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'i ming nyid du brjod do //
analyzed: ming gi tshogs dang / tshig gi tshogs dang / yi ge'i tshogs su gyur pa'i chos bstan pa gang yin pa de dag la yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'i ming nyid du brjod do //
translated: And the teachings that have become the collection of names, the collection of words, and the collection of letters are also called by the name ‚Äúperfection of wisdom.‚Äù

original: de ltar ji tsam du rnam pa de dag nyid mngon par ston pa theg pa chen po'i tshul gang yin pa de dag thams cad la yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar ji tsam du rnam pa de dag nyid mngon par ston pa theg pa chen po'i tshul gang yin pa de dag thams cad la yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: And in that way, all those methods of the Great Vehicle that teach just those aspects are also called ‚Äúperfection of wisdom.‚Äù

original: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya bar brjod pa de dag las 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi sas bsdus pa'i shes rab 'jig rten las 'das pa rnam par mi rtog pa la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya bar brjod pa de dag las 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi sas bsdus pa'i shes rab 'jig rten las 'das pa rnam par mi rtog pa la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: And in that way, among those that are called ‚Äúperfection of wisdom,‚Äù the perfection of wisdom that is included in the buddha stage, which is supramundane and nonconceptual, is called ‚Äúperfection of wisdom.‚Äù

original: de nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la brtson par bya'o zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba shin tu yongs su dag pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig
analyzed: de nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la brtson par bya'o zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba shin tu yongs su dag pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig
translated: Then one should strive in this perfection of wisdom. This means one should strive in the perfection of wisdom that is completely pure, free from all conceptual thoughts.

original: go // kha cig na re 'dir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya @41b ba ni theg pa chen po la bya bas na /
analyzed: go // kha cig na re 'dir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya @41b ba ni theg pa chen po la bya bas na /
translated: Some say that here the perfection of wisdom refers to the Great Vehicle,

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa spangs te /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa spangs te /
translated: so one should abandon the Hearer Vehicle and the Solitary Buddha Vehicle,

original: theg pa chen po la brtson par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes zer ro //
analyzed: theg pa chen po la brtson par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes zer ro //
translated: and this means one should strive in the Great Vehicle.

original: kha cig na re de la gang gi tshe shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la bya bar gyur pa de'i tshe ni don du zhes bya bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: kha cig na re de la gang gi tshe shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la bya bar gyur pa de'i tshe ni don du zhes bya bar rig par bya ste /
translated: Some say that when the perfection of wisdom refers to the knowledge of all things, then it should be understood as the meaning.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don du zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi don du brtson par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don du zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi don du brtson par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: For the sake of the perfection of wisdom means for the sake of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: gang gi tshe rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab bam /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab bam /
translated: When nonconceptual wisdom

original: theg pa chen po la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya bar brjod par gyur pa de'i tshe ni la zhes bya bar brjod par rig par bya'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: theg pa chen po la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya bar brjod par gyur pa de'i tshe ni la zhes bya bar brjod par rig par bya'o zhes zer ro //
translated: is called the perfection of wisdom in the Mahayana, then it should be understood as la.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson par bya'o zhes bya ba la brtson pa rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson par bya'o zhes bya ba la brtson pa rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: One should strive in the perfection of wisdom means there are three kinds of striving:

original: bslab pa la brtson pa dang / spyod pa la brtson pa dang / yang dag par 'grub pa la brtson pa'o //
analyzed: bslab pa la brtson pa dang / spyod pa la brtson pa dang / yang dag par 'grub pa la brtson pa'o //
translated: striving in training, striving in practice, and striving in true accomplishment.

original: de la nyan pa dang / bsam pa la sogs pa'i dus ni bslab pa la brtson pa ste /
analyzed: de la nyan pa dang / bsam pa la sogs pa'i dus ni bslab pa la brtson pa ste /
translated: Among them, the time of listening, reflection, etc. is striving in training.

original: de yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson par bya'o zhes bya ba 'og nas 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: de yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson par bya'o zhes bya ba 'og nas 'chad pa'o //
translated: Moreover, it is said below that one should strive in the perfection of wisdom.

original: sgrub pa'i dus na ni spyad pa la brtson par bya ba ste de yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o zhes 'og nas 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i dus na ni spyad pa la brtson par bya ba ste de yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o zhes 'og nas 'chad pa'o //
translated: At the time of practice, one should strive in practice, and it is said below that one should practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: rab tu rtogs pa'i dus na ni yang dag par 'grub pa la brtson pa ste /
analyzed: rab tu rtogs pa'i dus na ni yang dag par 'grub pa la brtson pa ste /
translated: At the time of realization, one should strive in true accomplishment.
