translated: By compassion, all actions are counted as the accumulation of merit, because they are done for the sake of sentient beings.

original: shes rab kyis ni byang chub kyi don gyi phyir ye shes kyi tshogs su bgrang ngo //
analyzed: shes rab kyis ni byang chub kyi don gyi phyir ye shes kyi tshogs su bgrang ngo //
translated: By wisdom, they are counted as the accumulation of wisdom, because they are for the sake of enlightenment.

original: de bas na yongs su gtong ba med pa'i tshul gyis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na yongs su gtong ba med pa'i tshul gyis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, the perfection of generosity is completed by the method of non-abandonment.

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' rnams sa dang po la de bzhin nyid rtogs pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' rnams sa dang po la de bzhin nyid rtogs pa nas bzung ste /
translated: Here, from the time of realizing suchness on the first ground,

original: sbyor ba thams cad la don dam par btsal na mngon sum du mthong bas de bzhin nyid du gnas par 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba thams cad la don dam par btsal na mngon sum du mthong bas de bzhin nyid du gnas par 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: all practices of the bodhisattvas are established in suchness, not otherwise, because they are directly seen when ultimately investigated.

original: de bzhin nyid de yang sbyin pa byed pa'i tshe ni sus kyang sbyin pa'am blang bar mi nus te /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid de yang sbyin pa byed pa'i tshe ni sus kyang sbyin pa'am blang bar mi nus te /
translated: When generosity is practiced, no one can give or receive it.

original: de bas na don dam par yongs su gtong ba zhes bya ba gang yang med do //
analyzed: de bas na don dam par yongs su gtong ba zhes bya ba gang yang med do //
translated: Therefore, ultimately, there is no such thing as giving.

original: bza' ba dang btung ba dang mal cha la sogs pa yongs su gtong ba gang yin pa de dag ni kun brtag pa'i chos la gnas pa'i phyir rmi lam dang sgyu ma bzhin du yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bza' ba dang btung ba dang mal cha la sogs pa yongs su gtong ba gang yin pa de dag ni kun brtag pa'i chos la gnas pa'i phyir rmi lam dang sgyu ma bzhin du yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The giving of food, drink, bedding, and so on is not real, like a dream or an illusion, because it is based on imaginary phenomena.

original: de ltar don dam par yongs su gtong ba'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba nyid la yongs su gtong ba med pa'i tshul zhes bya'o //üîΩyongs @44a * //
analyzed: de ltar don dam par yongs su gtong ba'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba nyid la yongs su gtong ba med pa'i tshul zhes bya'o // yongs @44a * //
translated: Thus, the absence of giving is called the method of giving, because it is free from the characteristic of giving in the ultimate sense.

original: su gtong ba med pa'i tshul des dngos po la sbyin par bya ba dang / bdag la gtong ba po dang / slong ba la len par byed pa dang gsum mi dmigs te /
analyzed: su gtong ba med pa'i tshul des dngos po la sbyin par bya ba dang / bdag la gtong ba po dang / slong ba la len par byed pa dang gsum mi dmigs te /
translated: By this method of giving, the three things that are given, the giver, and the recipient are not perceived.

original: dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid dang bral ba nyid do //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid dang bral ba nyid do //
translated: This is because they are free from the nature of being perceived.

original: phyir zhes bya ba ni brten cing bzung nas sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyir zhes bya ba ni brten cing bzung nas sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúbecause‚Äù means that the perfection of giving is completed by relying on and upholding giving.

original: dang por ni snying rje'i stobs kyis kun rdzob kyi tshul la gnas te 'jig rten pa'i spyod pa'i dbang gis sbyin pa byed do //
analyzed: dang por ni snying rje'i stobs kyis kun rdzob kyi tshul la gnas te 'jig rten pa'i spyod pa'i dbang gis sbyin pa byed do //
translated: First, by the power of compassion, one abides in the conventional way and gives gifts by the power of worldly conduct.

original: de nas shes rab kyi dbang gis don dam pa'i tshul la gnas te 'jig rten las 'das pa'i spyod pa'i dbang gis thams cad kyang shes rab kyis yongs su btsal na dmigs su med par gyur pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: de nas shes rab kyi dbang gis don dam pa'i tshul la gnas te 'jig rten las 'das pa'i spyod pa'i dbang gis thams cad kyang shes rab kyis yongs su btsal na dmigs su med par gyur pa de'i tshe /
translated: Then, by the power of wisdom, one abides in the ultimate way and by the power of supramundane conduct, all things are thoroughly investigated by wisdom and become unobservable. At that time,

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa zhes bya ba'i ming du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa zhes bya ba'i ming du 'gyur ro //
translated: the perfection of giving is said to be complete.

original: de bas na dang po sems bskyed pa'i dmigs par gyur pa sems can dang / byang chub gnyis yongs su ma btang bar gyur te /
analyzed: de bas na dang po sems bskyed pa'i dmigs par gyur pa sems can dang / byang chub gnyis yongs su ma btang bar gyur te /
translated: Therefore, the two objects of the first generation of the mind, sentient beings and enlightenment, are not abandoned.

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i ming yang dag pa'i don dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i ming yang dag pa'i don dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: For that reason, the name bodhisattva becomes meaningful.

original: de ltar na sbyin par bya ba dang / gtong ba po dang / len pa po rnams mi dmigs pa dang / sbyin pa dag shin tu 'gal ba yin na ji ltar na 'gal ba med pa lta bur 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na sbyin par bya ba dang / gtong ba po dang / len pa po rnams mi dmigs pa dang / sbyin pa dag shin tu 'gal ba yin na ji ltar na 'gal ba med pa lta bur 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Thus, the object given, the giver, and the receiver are not observed, and giving is utterly contradictory. How could it be as if there is no contradiction?

original: thabs mkhas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i stobs kyis 'gyur te /
analyzed: thabs mkhas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i stobs kyis 'gyur te /
translated: It is due to the power of the perfection of skillful means.

original: thabs mkhas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni kun rdzob 'dzin pa'i snying rje dang / don dam pa 'dzin pa'i shes rab gnyis kyis skam la rgyu ba dang / chu na rgyu ba'i srog chags kyi sbyor ba bzhin du sbyor ba'i khyad par shin tu 'gal ba yin du zin kyang sbyor ba'i rnam pas 'gal ba med par grogs byas nas cig car sgrub cing 'jug ste /
analyzed: thabs mkhas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni kun rdzob 'dzin pa'i snying rje dang / don dam pa 'dzin pa'i shes rab gnyis kyis skam la rgyu ba dang / chu na rgyu ba'i srog chags kyi sbyor ba bzhin du sbyor ba'i khyad par shin tu 'gal ba yin du zin kyang sbyor ba'i rnam pas 'gal ba med par grogs byas nas cig car sgrub cing 'jug ste /
translated: The perfection of skillful means is the union of the two‚Äîthe compassion that apprehends the conventional and the wisdom that apprehends the ultimate‚Äîjust like the union of the land-dwelling and water-dwelling creatures. Although the two are utterly contradictory, they are not contradictory in terms of their function. They assist each other and are simultaneously accomplished and engaged.

original: byang chub kyi bar du bsod nams kyi tshogs dang / ye shes kyi tshogs thams cad sgrub pa ni byang chub dang sems can rnams la phan 'dogs pa'i mchog yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: byang chub kyi bar du bsod nams kyi tshogs dang / ye shes kyi tshogs thams cad sgrub pa ni byang chub dang sems can rnams la phan 'dogs pa'i mchog yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: The supreme benefit for enlightenment and sentient beings is the accumulation of all the stores of merit and knowledge up to enlightenment.

original: 'og nas kyang skabs ji lta ba de bzhin du de dag 'chad do //üîΩltung ba mi 'byung ba dang / lhag par ltung ba mi 'byung ba'i phyir tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba la byang chub sems dpa' khyim pa ni byang @44b chub sems dpa'i sdom pa'i bslab pa yang dag par blangs te gnas /
analyzed: 'og nas kyang skabs ji lta ba de bzhin du de dag 'chad do // ltung ba mi 'byung ba dang / lhag par ltung ba mi 'byung ba'i phyir tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba la byang chub sems dpa' khyim pa ni byang @44b chub sems dpa'i sdom pa'i bslab pa yang dag par blangs te gnas /
translated: And later on, they are explained in the same way, according to the context.üîΩThe perfection of morality is completed in order to avoid downfalls and to avoid excessive downfalls.üîΩA lay bodhisattva who has taken up the training in the bodhisattva vow and remains in it,

original: rab tu byung ba ni sdom pa'i bslab pa gnyis ka yang dag par blangs te gnas pa na ltung ba 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba ni sdom pa'i bslab pa gnyis ka yang dag par blangs te gnas pa na ltung ba 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and a monastic who remains in both the vow of individual liberation and the training in the bodhisattva vow, will not incur downfalls.

original: gal te ltung ba byung na yang dus las yol bar lhag par ltung ba mi 'byung gi myur zhing myur du mthol bar byed de /
analyzed: gal te ltung ba byung na yang dus las yol bar lhag par ltung ba mi 'byung gi myur zhing myur du mthol bar byed de /
translated: Even if a downfall does occur, it will not be a serious downfall because it is not past the time for confession.

original: de bas na ltung ba mi 'byung ba dang / lhag par ltung ba mi 'byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na ltung ba mi 'byung ba dang / lhag par ltung ba mi 'byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said that downfalls do not occur and serious downfalls do not occur.

original: 'dir yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te zhes bya bar snyegs te /üîΩbdag ni tshul khrims dang ldan pa'o //üîΩ'di ni tshul khrims so //
analyzed: 'dir yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te zhes bya bar snyegs te / bdag ni tshul khrims dang ldan pa'o // 'di ni tshul khrims so //
translated: Here, too, the phrase ‚Äústanding in the perfection of wisdom‚Äù is to be supplied.üîΩThe three concepts ‚ÄúI am moral,‚Äù ‚Äúthis is morality,‚Äù and ‚Äúthis is immorality‚Äù are not apprehended.

original: 'di ni 'chal ba'i tshul khrims so zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa gsum mi dmigs pas 'khor gsum yongs su dag par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ni 'chal ba'i tshul khrims so zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa gsum mi dmigs pas 'khor gsum yongs su dag par rig par bya ste /
translated: Thus, the three spheres are completely pure.

original: 'di ltar 'og nas kyang bdag ni tshul khrims dang ldan pa'o //üîΩ'di ni tshul khrims so //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'og nas kyang bdag ni tshul khrims dang ldan pa'o // 'di ni tshul khrims so //
translated: As it will be said below,

original: 'di ni 'chal ba'i tshul khrims so zhes bya bas rlom sems su mi byed do zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'di ni 'chal ba'i tshul khrims so zhes bya bas rlom sems su mi byed do zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúI am moral,‚Äù ‚Äúthis is morality,‚Äù and ‚Äúthis is immorality‚Äù are not conceptualized.

original: 'khrug pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo nyid bstan te /
analyzed: 'khrug pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo nyid bstan te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause there is no agitation‚Äù indicates the nature of the perfection of patience.

original: de yang snying rje'i dbang gis sems can la 'khrug pa med pa dang / shes rab kyi dbang gis 'du byed rnams la bdag med par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang snying rje'i dbang gis sems can la 'khrug pa med pa dang / shes rab kyi dbang gis 'du byed rnams la bdag med par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, because of the power of compassion, there is no agitation toward sentient beings; and because of the power of wisdom, there is the realization that compounded things are devoid of a self.

original: 'dir yang bzod pa dang / bzod par bya ba dang / gnod sems rnams mi dmigs pas 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa ni 'og nas skabs ji lta ba nyid du 'chad do //
analyzed: 'dir yang bzod pa dang / bzod par bya ba dang / gnod sems rnams mi dmigs pas 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa ni 'og nas skabs ji lta ba nyid du 'chad do //
translated: Here, the complete purity of the three spheres should be understood as it is presented in the sutra in the appropriate places, through the nonapprehension of patience, the object of patience, and malice.

original: lus dang sems kyi brtson 'grus nyams pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'dis ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la 'jug pa bstan te /
analyzed: lus dang sems kyi brtson 'grus nyams pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'dis ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la 'jug pa bstan te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause there is no decline in physical or mental effort‚Äù indicates the entrance to the perfection of effort.

original: rgyun du chud pa dang gus pa dang nan tan du lus dang sems kyi brtson 'grus nyams par mi byed par brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rgyun du chud pa dang gus pa dang nan tan du lus dang sems kyi brtson 'grus nyams par mi byed par brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: One should complete the perfection of effort by not letting the effort of body and mind decline through constant practice, respect, and earnest application.

original: ma btang ba de yang shes rab dang / snying rje nyid kyi 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: ma btang ba de yang shes rab dang / snying rje nyid kyi 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: And that non-abandonment is due to wisdom and compassion.

original: 'dir yang brtson 'grus dang ldan pa dang / brtson 'grus dang le lo rnams mi dmigs pas pha rol tu phyin pa nyid du 'grub po //
analyzed: 'dir yang brtson 'grus dang ldan pa dang / brtson 'grus dang le lo rnams mi dmigs pas pha rol tu phyin pa nyid du 'grub po //
translated: Here, too, one accomplishes the perfection of effort by not objectifying effort and laziness.

original: ro myang ba med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gal te bdag gi don du bsam gtan la 'jug na ni bsam @45a * //
analyzed: ro myang ba med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gal te bdag gi don du bsam gtan la 'jug na ni bsam @45a * //
translated: Because of the absence of relishing. If one enters into the meditative concentrations for one's own sake, one would relish the taste of the meditative concentrations.

original: gtan gyi ro myong bar byed par 'gyur na 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' ni bdag gi don 'ba' zhig la sbyor ba thams cad la sdig pa bzhin du rnam par smod par byed na /
analyzed: gtan gyi ro myong bar byed par 'gyur na 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' ni bdag gi don 'ba' zhig la sbyor ba thams cad la sdig pa bzhin du rnam par smod par byed na /
translated: But the bodhisattva, like a criminal, despises all applications that are solely for one's own sake.

original: de la bsam gtan gyi ro myang ba'i yid la byed pa lta ga la yod /
analyzed: de la bsam gtan gyi ro myang ba'i yid la byed pa lta ga la yod /
translated: How could there be any attention that savors the taste of the meditative concentrations?

original: de bas na nyon mongs pa can dang / dag pa dang zag pa med pa'i bsam gtan gsum las dag pa dang / zag pa med pa nyid la snyoms par 'jug gi nyon mongs pa can la mi 'jug go zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de bas na nyon mongs pa can dang / dag pa dang zag pa med pa'i bsam gtan gsum las dag pa dang / zag pa med pa nyid la snyoms par 'jug gi nyon mongs pa can la mi 'jug go zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, one enters into meditative absorption in the pure and uncontaminated meditative concentrations, but not in the defiled ones.

original: 'dir yang ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang g-yeng pa rnams mi dmigs pas pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir yang ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang g-yeng pa rnams mi dmigs pas pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, too, the perfection is completed by the nonapprehension of meditative concentration and distraction, as well as of one who possesses meditative concentration.

original: chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir de bzhin nyid tsam du mthong bas ni 'jig rten pa'i kun brtags pa'i chos thams cad mi dmigs la /
analyzed: chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir de bzhin nyid tsam du mthong bas ni 'jig rten pa'i kun brtags pa'i chos thams cad mi dmigs la /
translated: Because all things are nonapprehended means that because one sees only thusness, one does not apprehend any of the imagined things of the mundane.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa rnams la yang rnam par mi rtog ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa rnams la yang rnam par mi rtog ste /
translated: And one does not even imagine the supramundane.

original: de bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is called the perfection of wisdom.

original: ji ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed ce na /
translated: How does one stand in the perfection of wisdom and perfect the perfection of wisdom?

original: gang gi tshe shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / theg pa chen po la bya ba de'i tshe na ni klan kar 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: gang gi tshe shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / theg pa chen po la bya ba de'i tshe na ni klan kar 'gyur ba med do //
translated: When the perfection of wisdom is taken to be the knowledge of all aspects and the Great Vehicle, then there is no fault.

original: gang gi tshe rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bya bar gyur pa de'i tshe yang don dam pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos gang yang med do snyam du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam
analyzed: gang gi tshe rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bya bar gyur pa de'i tshe yang don dam pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos gang yang med do snyam du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam
translated: When it is taken to be the nonconceptual perfection of wisdom, then also one should understand that ultimately there are no phenomena of the perfection of wisdom.

original: par rtog pa med pa'i bdag nyid rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: par rtog pa med pa'i bdag nyid rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa yin te /
translated: One stands in the nonconceptual nature of the perfection of wisdom, the nonconceptual perfection of wisdom.

original: de'i tshe ni khams gsum pa la sogs pa de bzhin nyid tsam du zad do snyam du kun rdzob kyi rnam par skyes pa'i shes rab sbyor ba'i lam du rtogs pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i bdag nyid yin yang rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyis yongs
analyzed: de'i tshe ni khams gsum pa la sogs pa de bzhin nyid tsam du zad do snyam du kun rdzob kyi rnam par skyes pa'i shes rab sbyor ba'i lam du rtogs pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i bdag nyid yin yang rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyis yongs
translated: At that time, one thinks, ‚ÄúThe three realms and so on are merely suchness,‚Äù and the wisdom that arises in the aspect of the relative is realized on the path of preparation.üîΩ

original: su zin pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: su zin pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya bar 'gyur te /
translated: At that time, the wisdom that arises in the aspect of the relative, thinking that the three realms and so on are merely suchness, is the realization on the path of preparation. Although it has the nature of discursive thought, it is called the perfection of wisdom because it is fully embraced by non-conceptual wisdom.

original: de bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom par dgongs pas klan kar 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: de bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom par dgongs pas klan kar 'gyur ba med do //
translated: Therefore, it is not contradictory to think that, abiding in the perfection of wisdom, one cultivates the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'dir @45b yang shes rab can dang / shes rab dang / 'chal ba'i shes rab rnams mi dmigs pas 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir @45b yang shes rab can dang / shes rab dang / 'chal ba'i shes rab rnams mi dmigs pas 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Here, it should be understood that the three spheres are completely pure because of the non-apprehension of the wise, wisdom, and faulty wisdom.

original: de'i 'og tu sh'a ri'i bu shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas byang chub kyi phyogs kyi spyod pa ston to //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu sh'a ri'i bu shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas byang chub kyi phyogs kyi spyod pa ston to //
translated: Then, after that, Shariputra, abiding in the perfection of wisdom, should complete the four foundations of mindfulness.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams bsgom pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa mya ngan las 'das pa la gzhol bar byed pa rnams nyid la rigs kyi /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams bsgom pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa mya ngan las 'das pa la gzhol bar byed pa rnams nyid la rigs kyi /
translated: The cultivation of the factors of enlightenment is appropriate for those in the Hearer and Solitary Realizer vehicles who are intent on nirvana,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la mi rigs so zhe na yang 'di la nyes pa med de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la mi rigs so zhe na yang 'di la nyes pa med de /
translated: but it is not appropriate for Bodhisattvas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du rtogs par bzhed pa dang / chos thams cad mi dmigs par lhur len pas ci byang chub kyi chos rnams don dam par yod dam /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du rtogs par bzhed pa dang / chos thams cad mi dmigs par lhur len pas ci byang chub kyi chos rnams don dam par yod dam /
translated: There is no fault here, because Bodhisattvas, wishing to understand all phenomena in all their aspects, and intent on not observing any phenomena,

original: 'on te med ces de dag la yongs su tshol bas rigs so //
analyzed: 'on te med ces de dag la yongs su tshol bas rigs so //
translated: it is appropriate for them to investigate whether the factors of enlightenment exist ultimately or not.

original: 'o na de ltar gyur na byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams bsgoms pa'i rgyur mya ngan las 'das pa mngon sum du mdzad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na de ltar gyur na byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams bsgoms pa'i rgyur mya ngan las 'das pa mngon sum du mdzad par 'gyur te /
translated: Well then, if that is so, then nirvana would be actualized as the cause of cultivating the factors of enlightenment.

original: de'i phyir / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis rgyun du zhugs pa nas dgra bcom pa nyid kyi bar du thob par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis rgyun du zhugs pa nas dgra bcom pa nyid kyi bar du thob par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Therefore, it would follow that bodhisattvas would attain the state of stream enterer up to the state of arhat.

original: yang sngon gyi rtsol ba'i shugs kyi mthu nyid kyis de 'grub par 'di la nyes pa med de /
analyzed: yang sngon gyi rtsol ba'i shugs kyi mthu nyid kyis de 'grub par 'di la nyes pa med de /
translated: There is no fault here, for they accomplish that by the power of the momentum of their previous exertion.

original: yang gang dag 'khor ba la nyes dmigs su mthong nas yid byung ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la yon tan du mthong nas de nyid don du gnyer cing sgrub pa de dag ni sngon gyi rtsol ba'i shugs kyis dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams bsgoms ba'i rgyus 'bad mi dgos bar mya ngan las 'das pa mngon sum du byedüîΩpar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: yang gang dag 'khor ba la nyes dmigs su mthong nas yid byung ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la yon tan du mthong nas de nyid don du gnyer cing sgrub pa de dag ni sngon gyi rtsol ba'i shugs kyis dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams bsgoms ba'i rgyus 'bad mi dgos bar mya ngan las 'das pa mngon sum du byedüîΩpar 'gyur gyi /
translated: Those who see samsara as a problem and are disgusted with it and who see nirvana as a good quality and strive for and accomplish it, by the cause of cultivating the four establishments of mindfulness through the momentum of their previous exertion, they actualize nirvana without needing to make effort.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang dag 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la sems mnyam pa sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba bskyed pa lhur len pa dag ni sems can la phan pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir 'khor ba la yang mya ngan lasüîΩ'das pa bzhin du yon tan du gzigs la sems ca la phan 'dogs pa'i gnas pa ma yin pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa la yang 'khor ba bzhin du mi mthun par gzigs pa dang @46a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang dag 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la sems mnyam pa sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba bskyed pa lhur len pa dag ni sems can la phan pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir 'khor ba la yang mya ngan las 'das pa bzhin du yon tan du gzigs la sems ca la phan 'dogs pa'i gnas pa ma yin pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa la yang 'khor ba bzhin du mi mthun par gzigs pa dang @46a * //
translated: Bodhisattvas who are even minded with regard to samsara and nirvana, who are intent on benefiting and making sentient beings happy, see samsara as a good quality, like nirvana, because it is the cause for benefiting beings.üîΩAnd they see nirvana as being like samsara, not as something to be opposed, because it is not a state of benefit for sentient beings.

original: chos nyid tsam du zad pa'i phyir de gnyi ga yang mnyam pa nyid du gzigs pas dmigs su med pa'i ngo bo nyid du so sor rtog pa'i phyir byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams bsgoms te /
analyzed: chos nyid tsam du zad pa'i phyir de gnyi ga yang mnyam pa nyid du gzigs pas dmigs su med pa'i ngo bo nyid du so sor rtog pa'i phyir byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams bsgoms te /
translated: And because both samsara and nirvana are the same in being no more than the nature of phenomena, they see them as the same and they meditate on the elements that lead to enlightenment, discerning that they are by nature unobservable.

original: de dag ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams mngon sum du mdzad pa kho na tsam du zad kyi rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa'am /
analyzed: de dag ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams mngon sum du mdzad pa kho na tsam du zad kyi rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa'am /
translated: They are merely the direct realization of the factors of enlightenment, but they are not the direct realization of the fruits such as stream-entry,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa la mngon sum du mdzad pa'i phyir nye bar mdzad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la mngon sum du mdzad pa'i phyir nye bar mdzad pa ma yin te /
translated: or of nirvana.

original: de nyid la yongs su 'dris pa'i shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid la yongs su 'dris pa'i shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That is called the knowledge of thorough familiarity.

original: 'di ltar 'og nas kyang byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams la gnas nas 'di ni yongs su 'dris par bya ba'i dus yin gyi mngon sum du bya ba'i dus ni ma yin par shes so zhes bya ba la sogs pa yongs su 'dris pa'i shes pa bstanüîΩpa las 'chad do //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'og nas kyang byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams la gnas nas 'di ni yongs su 'dris par bya ba'i dus yin gyi mngon sum du bya ba'i dus ni ma yin par shes so zhes bya ba la sogs pa yongs su 'dris pa'i shes pa bstanüîΩpa las 'chad do //
translated: Thus, below it also explains the knowledge of thorough familiarity, saying, ‚ÄúDwelling in the factors of enlightenment, one knows, ‚ÄòThis is the time for thorough familiarity, not the time for direct realization.‚Äô‚Äù

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi zhes bya ba ni de la lus dang / tshor ba dang / sems dang chos rnams dang / rnam pa bzhi rnams la rjes su lta ba rnam pa bzhi la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi zhes bya ba ni de la lus dang / tshor ba dang / sems dang chos rnams dang / rnam pa bzhi rnams la rjes su lta ba rnam pa bzhi la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi zhes bya ste /
translated: The four establishments of mindfulness are the four investigations of the body, feelings, mind, and phenomena.

original: sngar yongs su shes par mdzad nas de'i 'og tu yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su tshol ba na /
analyzed: sngar yongs su shes par mdzad nas de'i 'og tu yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su tshol ba na /
translated: Having previously understood them, he then investigated them correctly and as they are.

original: lus dang / tshor ba dang / sems dang chos rnams dang / de dag la dmigs pa'i dran pa dang / shes rab gnyis dang / de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems las byung ba'i chos rnams kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid du thugs su chud pas yang dag pa'i don ma yin par yongs su shes par mdzad de /
analyzed: lus dang / tshor ba dang / sems dang chos rnams dang / de dag la dmigs pa'i dran pa dang / shes rab gnyis dang / de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems las byung ba'i chos rnams kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid du thugs su chud pas yang dag pa'i don ma yin par yongs su shes par mdzad de /
translated: He understood that the body, feelings, mind, and phenomena, the mindfulness that focuses on them, the two of wisdom and mindfulness, and the mental factors concomitant with them are the imagined nature, and thus he understood them to be not the real meaning.

original: don dam pa brjod du med pa ni dran pa dang / shes rab gnyis kyi spyod yul ma yin pas dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i mtshan nyid ni don dam par yod pa ma yin par rtogs pa la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams yongs su rdzogs parüîΩmdzad ces bya'o //
analyzed: don dam pa brjod du med pa ni dran pa dang / shes rab gnyis kyi spyod yul ma yin pas dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i mtshan nyid ni don dam par yod pa ma yin par rtogs pa la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par mdzad ces bya'o //
translated: Since the ultimate is inexpressible, it is not the domain of either memory or wisdom. Therefore, the perfection of wisdom is said to be the perfection of the applications of mindfulness, because it is based on the realization that the defining characteristics of the applications of mindfulness do not ultimately exist.

original: de bas na 'bum pa las kyang dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams dmigs su med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na 'bum pa las kyang dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams dmigs su med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, the Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Lines also says, ‚ÄúBecause the applications of mindfulness are non-apprehensible.‚Äù

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos bsgom pa 'di yang 'og nas theg pa chen po bstan pa las rgyas par ston to //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos bsgom pa 'di yang 'og nas theg pa chen po bstan pa las rgyas par ston to //
translated: The cultivation of the factors of enlightenment will be explained extensively below in the teaching on the Great Vehicle.

original: de bzhin du yang dag pa'i spong ba rnams la yang sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang dag pa'i spong ba rnams la yang sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: The correct exertions should also be applied in the same way.

original: yang dag pa'i spong ba la sogs @46b pa'i mtshan nyid kun rdzob tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i spong ba la sogs @46b pa'i mtshan nyid kun rdzob tsam du zad kyi /
translated: The defining characteristics of the correct exertions and so on are mere conventionalities.

original: don dam par yang dag pa'i spong ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas yang dag pa'i spong ba la sogs pa dmigs su med pa'i ngo bo nyid du yongs su mkhyen pa la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa
analyzed: don dam par yang dag pa'i spong ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas yang dag pa'i spong ba la sogs pa dmigs su med pa'i ngo bo nyid du yongs su mkhyen pa la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa
translated: Because the nature of the reality of the perfect abandonments and so on is the non-entityness of things, they are fully known to be the nature of the non-observation of the perfect abandonments and so on.

original: la gnas te /
analyzed: la gnas te /
translated: Abiding in the perfection of wisdom,

original: byang chub kyi phyogs rnams yongs su rdzogs par mdzad do zhes bshad do //üîΩstong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba la rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum ni mya ngan las 'das pa thog par byed pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs rnams yongs su rdzogs par mdzad do zhes bshad do // stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba la rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum ni mya ngan las 'das pa thog par byed pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: they perfect the factors of enlightenment.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs bsgom pa dang mthun pas na byang chub kyi phyogs nyid kyi nang du bgrang ngo //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs bsgom pa dang mthun pas na byang chub kyi phyogs nyid kyi nang du bgrang ngo //
translated: The three doors of liberation are counted as factors of enlightenment because they are compatible with the cultivation of the factors of enlightenment since they bring about the attainment of nirvana.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i skabs su gtogs pas ting nge 'dzin gsum zhes brjod do //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i skabs su gtogs pas ting nge 'dzin gsum zhes brjod do //
translated: Since this is the section on bodhisattvas, they are called the three concentrations.

original: de la stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba ni yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyis stong pa la kun brtags pa'i rnam pa des stong ngo zhes stong pa'i rnam par bsgom pa na sems rtse gcig pa nyid du gyurüîΩpa la stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //üîΩbrjod du med pa'i don dam pa de nyid nam mkha' bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan ma thams cad dang bral ba /
analyzed: de la stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba ni yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyis stong pa la kun brtags pa'i rnam pa des stong ngo zhes stong pa'i rnam par bsgom pa na sems rtse gcig pa nyid du gyur pa la stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o // brjod du med pa'i don dam pa de nyid nam mkha' bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan ma thams cad dang bral ba /
translated: The concentration of emptiness is the one pointed mind that arises when one meditates on the aspect of emptiness, emptiness of the imaginary nature by the perfected nature.üîΩThe concentration of wishlessness is the one pointed mind that arises when one meditates on the aspect of wishlessness, the absence of desire for the three realms by the perfected nature.

original: mtshan ma'i rnam pa med pa'i mtshan nyid spros pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba yin pas zhi ba'i rnam par bsgom pa na sems rtse gcig tu gyur pa la mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma'i rnam pa med pa'i mtshan nyid spros pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba yin pas zhi ba'i rnam par bsgom pa na sems rtse gcig tu gyur pa la mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
translated: The concentration of signlessness is the one pointed mind that arises when one meditates on the aspect of signlessness, the ultimate truth that is inexpressible, like space, free of all signs of form and so on, devoid of the sign of the absence of signs, the pacification of all elaborations.

original: de bzhin du khams gsum pa rnams dngos po med pa ngo bo nyid kyi rnam par gzigs pas chos thams cad la mi mthun pa'i 'du shes nye bar bzhag nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du khams gsum pa rnams dngos po med pa ngo bo nyid kyi rnam par gzigs pas chos thams cad la mi mthun pa'i 'du shes nye bar bzhag nas /
translated: Similarly, by seeing the three realms as essentially unreal, he establishes the notion of non-differentiation with regard to all things.

original: phyi ma la smon pa'i gnas su mi byed par yang dag par rjes su gzigs pa na sems rtse gcig tu gyur pa la smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyi ma la smon pa'i gnas su mi byed par yang dag par rjes su gzigs pa na sems rtse gcig tu gyur pa la smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
translated: When he sees that they are not the basis for future aspirations, his mind becomes one-pointed, and this is called the concentration of wishlessness.

original: de'i 'og tu bsam gtan bzhi dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed pa'i spyod pa bstan te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bsam gtan bzhi dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed pa'i spyod pa bstan te /
translated: After that, he teaches the conduct that brings beings to full maturity, beginning with the four concentrations.

original: sems can rnams yongs su smin par bya ba de yang 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: sems can rnams yongs su smin par bya ba de yang 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa ste /
translated: The full maturity of beings is both mundane and supramundane.

original: bsam gtan dang ting nge 'dzin gyi phyogs dang / mngon par shes pa'i phyogs dang / ye shes kyi phyogs kyi @47a * //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang ting nge 'dzin gyi phyogs dang / mngon par shes pa'i phyogs dang / ye shes kyi phyogs kyi @47a * //
translated: It is to be accomplished by means of the factors of concentration and meditative absorption, the factors of preternatural knowledge, and the factors of gnosis.

original: chos rnams kyis bya dgos pas phyogs kyi chos gsum char yang der 'dus te /
analyzed: chos rnams kyis bya dgos pas phyogs kyi chos gsum char yang der 'dus te /
translated: So all three of these factors are included in that.

original: de la bsam gtan la sogs pa'i chos thams cad dang por sems can la phan par bya ba'i phyir kun rdzob tu bzung ste /
analyzed: de la bsam gtan la sogs pa'i chos thams cad dang por sems can la phan par bya ba'i phyir kun rdzob tu bzung ste /
translated: In this regard, all dharmas such as the meditative absorptions are first taken up conventionally in order to benefit sentient beings.üîΩLater, having thoroughly investigated the ultimate, they do not settle down on the identity of the meditative absorptions, and so on.

original: phyis don dam par yongs su btsal nas bsam gtan la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid du mngon par zhen par mi mdzad par snying rje dang thabs mkhas pa gnyis kyis yang kun rdzob nyid la dmigs nas sems can la phan par byed pa'i phyir sems can yongs su
analyzed: phyis don dam par yongs su btsal nas bsam gtan la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid du mngon par zhen par mi mdzad par snying rje dang thabs mkhas pa gnyis kyis yang kun rdzob nyid la dmigs nas sems can la phan par byed pa'i phyir sems can yongs su
translated: With both compassion and skillful means, they again focus on the conventional and benefit sentient beings.

original: smin par mdzad pa'i spyod pa rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: smin par mdzad pa'i spyod pa rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Thus, the conduct of bringing sentient beings to maturity is presented.

original: de la skyo ba rjes su dran pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la skyo ba rjes su dran pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Here, the recollection of weariness refers to

original: skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / stong pa dang /
analyzed: skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / stong pa dang /
translated: birth, aging, sickness, death, sorrow, lamentation, suffering, unhappiness, and agitation, as well as impermanence, emptiness,

original: bdag med ces bya ba la sogs pa yid byung bar 'gyur pa'i gnas rnams la dmigs nas nyes dmigs su mthong bas skyo ba yin la byed pa ni skyo ba rjes su dran pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bdag med ces bya ba la sogs pa yid byung bar 'gyur pa'i gnas rnams la dmigs nas nyes dmigs su mthong bas skyo ba yin la byed pa ni skyo ba rjes su dran pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The recollection of disenchantment is the disenchantment that arises from observing the bases of disenchantment, such as selflessness, etc., and seeing their faults.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyo ba rjes su dran pa ni chos thams cad bdag med cing dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa las /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyo ba rjes su dran pa ni chos thams cad bdag med cing dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa las /
translated: The bodhisattva's recollection of disenchantment is the mental attention that quickly precedes the understanding of those who, although all things are selfless and have the nature of being unreal,

original: byis pa rnams kyis snying po can du blo bskyed de 'jug par mthong nas de dag shes par bya ba myur du sngon du gtong ba'i yid la byed pa ni skyo ba rjes su dran pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byis pa rnams kyis snying po can du blo bskyed de 'jug par mthong nas de dag shes par bya ba myur du sngon du gtong ba'i yid la byed pa ni skyo ba rjes su dran pa zhes bya'o //
translated: still generate the idea that they have a core and engage in them.

original: sngar rjes su dran pa yid la byed pa'i dbang gis 'chi ba rjes su dran pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: sngar rjes su dran pa yid la byed pa'i dbang gis 'chi ba rjes su dran pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: The recollection of death was previously taught in the context of mental attention to the recollection of the Buddha.

original: phyis lhag mthong gi sgo nas 'chi ba'i chos nyid can du mthong ba la 'chi ba'i 'du shes zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: phyis lhag mthong gi sgo nas 'chi ba'i chos nyid can du mthong ba la 'chi ba'i 'du shes zhes gsungs so //
translated: Later, it is taught in the context of insight, seeing that all things have the nature of death. This is called the perception of death.

original: 'jig rten pa'i rig pa dang / bzo'i gnas thams cad dang / sgyu rtsal rnam pa sna tshogs drug cu rtsa bzhi la sogs pa la yid mi rton pa'i dga' ba ni 'jig rten thams cad la mngon par mi dga' ba'i 'du shes so //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i rig pa dang / bzo'i gnas thams cad dang / sgyu rtsal rnam pa sna tshogs drug cu rtsa bzhi la sogs pa la yid mi rton pa'i dga' ba ni 'jig rten thams cad la mngon par mi dga' ba'i 'du shes so //
translated: The perception of not delighting in the world is the delight in not relying on the mundane sciences, all the crafts, the sixty-four accomplishments, and so on.

original: khams gsum pa la chags su rung ba'i rgyu yang dag par rjes su ma gzigs pas de la 'dod pa med par gyur pa ni 'jig rten thams cad la yid mi rton pa'i 'du shes so //
analyzed: khams gsum pa la chags su rung ba'i rgyu yang dag par rjes su ma gzigs pas de la 'dod pa med par gyur pa ni 'jig rten thams cad la yid mi rton pa'i 'du shes so //
translated: The perception of not relying on the world is the absence of desire that comes from not seeing any cause for attachment to the three realms.

original: sdug bsngal shes pa bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba ni phung po la sogs pa'i @47b chos thams cad kun rdzob kyi sgo nas sdug bsngal nyid du mkhyen par mdzad nas de'i 'og tu de dag nyid don dam par shin tu dngos po med par mkhyen kyang sems
analyzed: sdug bsngal shes pa bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba ni phung po la sogs pa'i @47b chos thams cad kun rdzob kyi sgo nas sdug bsngal nyid du mkhyen par mdzad nas de'i 'og tu de dag nyid don dam par shin tu dngos po med par mkhyen kyang sems
translated: One should cultivate the knowledge of suffering. Having known all phenomena such as the aggregates as suffering from the perspective of the conventional, one should then know them as utterly non-existent in the ultimate.

original: can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir kun rdzob tu sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa nyid du mkhyen pa dang / gzhan dag la yang de bzhin du shes par mdzad pa'i mkhyen pa ni sdug bsngal shes pa ste /
analyzed: can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir kun rdzob tu sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa nyid du mkhyen pa dang / gzhan dag la yang de bzhin du shes par mdzad pa'i mkhyen pa ni sdug bsngal shes pa ste /
translated: The knowledge of suffering is the knowledge of the aspects of suffering itself in the conventional sense, in order to ripen those who are not yet ripened, and the knowledge of causing others to know in the same way.

original: de bzhin du thams cad la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du thams cad la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be applied to all the others.üîΩThe knowledge of the origin is the knowledge of the origin of those same aggregates, elements, sense-spheres, etc., the knowledge of causing that to be known, and the knowledge of being in accord with that.

original: phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa de dag nyid rab tu skye bar mkhyen pa dang / de shes par byed pa'i mkhyen pa dang / kun mthun par mkhyen pa ni kun 'byung ba shes pa'o //
analyzed: phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa de dag nyid rab tu skye bar mkhyen pa dang / de shes par byed pa'i mkhyen pa dang / kun mthun par mkhyen pa ni kun 'byung ba shes pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of cessation is the knowledge of the cessation of all the afflictions and suffering of oneself and others, the knowledge of the cause of complete cessation, and the knowledge of complete cessation.üîΩThe knowledge of the path is the knowledge of the path of the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment, the knowledge of causing that to be known, and the knowledge of being in accord with that.üîΩThe knowledge of suffering is the knowledge of the aggregates, elements, sense-spheres, etc. as suffering, the knowledge of causing that to be known, and the knowledge of being in accord with that.üîΩThe knowledge of the origin is the knowledge of the origin of those same aggregates, elements, sense-spheres, etc., the knowledge of causing that to be known, and the knowledge of being in accord with that.üîΩThe knowledge of cessation is the knowledge of the cessation of all the afflictions and suffering of oneself and others, the knowledge of the cause of complete cessation, and the knowledge of complete cessation.üîΩThe knowledge of the path is the knowledge of the path of the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment, the knowledge of causing that to be known, and the knowledge of being in accord with that.

translated: The knowledge of suffering is the knowledge of the aggregates, elements, sense-spheres, etc. as suffering, the knowledge of causing that to be known, and the knowledge of being in accord with that.üîΩThe knowledge of the origin is the knowledge of the origin of those same aggregates, elements, sense-spheres, etc., the knowledge of causing that to be known, and the knowledge of being in accord with that.üîΩThe knowledge of cessation is the knowledge of the cessation of all the afflictions and suffering of oneself and others, the knowledge of the cause of complete cessation, and the knowledge of complete cessation.üîΩThe knowledge of the path is the knowledge of the path of the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment, the knowledge of causing that to be known, and the knowledge of being in accord with that.üîΩThe knowledge of suffering

original: bdag dang gzhan dag gi srid pa'i skye bar skye ba thams cad mkhyen pa dang / mi skye ba'i rgyu mkhyen pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mi skye ba shes pa'o //üîΩkun rdzob tu chos thams cad mngon sum du mkhyen pa dang / don dam pa'i dbang gis de bzhin nyid du mkhyen pa ni chos shes pa'o //

original: kun rdzob tu chos thams cad rjes su dpag pas shes pa dang / mi rtag pa la sogs pa mngon sum du ma gyur kyang de lta bur 'gyur bar mkhyen pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams chos thams cad stong pa nyid du rjes su mthun par mkhyen pa ni rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu chos thams cad rjes su dpag pas shes pa dang / mi rtag pa la sogs pa mngon sum du ma gyur kyang de lta bur 'gyur bar mkhyen pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams chos thams cad stong pa nyid du rjes su mthun par mkhyen pa ni rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa'o //

original: 'dis ni skye mched stong pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni skye mched stong pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: This teaches the emptiness of the sense-spheres.

original: de nas yang don de nyid legs par gtan la dbab pa'i phyir nang dang phyi'i chos gnyis gcig tu byas te bsgom zhing /
analyzed: de nas yang don de nyid legs par gtan la dbab pa'i phyir nang dang phyi'i chos gnyis gcig tu byas te bsgom zhing /
translated: Then, in order to ascertain that meaning well, the inner and outer phenomena are made into one and meditated on.

original: 'di dag ni khams bco brgyad tsam du zad par mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'di dag ni khams bco brgyad tsam du zad par mthong ngo //
translated: These are seen as just the eighteen elements.

original: de'i phyir phyi nang stong pa nyid ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir phyi nang stong pa nyid ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, the emptiness of outer and inner is stated.

original: 'dis ni khams stong pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni khams stong pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: This teaches the emptiness of the elements.

original: yang na phyi rol pa dag na re zab po ni bdag yin no zhes zer te /
analyzed: yang na phyi rol pa dag na re zab po ni bdag yin no zhes zer te /
translated: Or, non-Buddhists say that the self is profound.

original: de'i phyir gang zag bdag med pa nyid bstan par dgos la /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang zag bdag med pa nyid bstan par dgos la /
translated: Therefore, the selflessness of persons is taught as the necessity.

original: chos 'di la zhugs pa dag na re zab po ni nang gi skye @54b mched rnams so zhes zer te /
analyzed: chos 'di la zhugs pa dag na re zab po ni nang gi skye @54b mched rnams so zhes zer te /
translated: Those who have entered this teaching say that the profound is the inner sense spheres.

original: de'i phyir nang gi skye mched rnams med pa nyid du bstan dgos te //
analyzed: de'i phyir nang gi skye mched rnams med pa nyid du bstan dgos te //
translated: Therefore, the nonexistence of the inner sense spheres must be taught.

original: de gnyis ka'i phyi nang stong pa nyid rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de gnyis ka'i phyi nang stong pa nyid rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The emptiness of outer and inner is presented for both of those.

original: de la mig ni bdag dang bdag gis stong /
analyzed: de la mig ni bdag dang bdag gis stong /
translated: The eye is empty of self and that which belongs to self.

original: rna ba ni bdag dang bdag gis stong zhes bya ba la sogs pas gang zag la bdag med pa'i sgo nas nang stong pa nyid bstan la /
analyzed: rna ba ni bdag dang bdag gis stong zhes bya ba la sogs pas gang zag la bdag med pa'i sgo nas nang stong pa nyid bstan la /
translated: The passage, ‚ÄúThe ear is empty of self and of what belongs to a self,‚Äù and so on, teaches the emptiness of internal phenomena from the perspective of the emptiness of the person.

original: mig mig gis stong /
analyzed: mig mig gis stong /
translated: The passage, ‚ÄúThe eye is empty of the eye,‚Äù

original: rna ba rna bas stong zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni chos bdag med pa'i sgo nas nang stong pa nyid bstan te /
analyzed: rna ba rna bas stong zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni chos bdag med pa'i sgo nas nang stong pa nyid bstan te /
translated: and so on, teaches the emptiness of internal phenomena from the perspective of the emptiness of phenomena.

original: rnam pa gnyis ka ltar bshad do //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis ka ltar bshad do //
translated: This is the explanation of both perspectives.

original: de la mig la yang rnam par rtog pa bzhi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de la mig la yang rnam par rtog pa bzhi 'byung ngo //
translated: In this regard, four misconceptions arise in relation to the eye.

original: mig bdag go zhes bya ba dang / bdag mig dang ldan no zhes bya ba dang / mig la bdag gnas so zhes bya ba dang / bdag la mig gnas so zhes bya ba rnams te /
analyzed: mig bdag go zhes bya ba dang / bdag mig dang ldan no zhes bya ba dang / mig la bdag gnas so zhes bya ba dang / bdag la mig gnas so zhes bya ba rnams te /
translated: The eye is the self, the self possesses eyes, the self dwells in the eye, and the eye dwells in the self.

original: dper na gzugs bdag yin par yang dag par rjes su mthong ba dang / bdag gzugs dang ldan pa dang / bdag la gzugs gnas pa dang / gzugs la bdag gnas pa zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na gzugs bdag yin par yang dag par rjes su mthong ba dang / bdag gzugs dang ldan pa dang / bdag la gzugs gnas pa dang / gzugs la bdag gnas pa zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: This is similar to the view that form is the self, the self possesses form, the self dwells in form, and form dwells in the self.

original: de la mig bdag yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni mig la bdag tu 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de la mig bdag yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni mig la bdag tu 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The statement The eye is the self is the grasping of the self in the eye.

original: bdag ni mig dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba dang / bdag la mig gnas so zhes bya ba dang / mig la bdag gnas so zhes bya ba 'di ni mig la bdag gir 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ni mig dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba dang / bdag la mig gnas so zhes bya ba dang / mig la bdag gnas so zhes bya ba 'di ni mig la bdag gir 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The statements I have an eye, The eye is in me, and The eye is mine are the grasping of the self as pertaining to the eye.

original: de la mig mi dmigs pa'i rnam par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pas 'dzin pa de bzhi spangs nas yang dag pa'i shes pas mig ni bdag dang bdag gis stong ngo zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ngo //
analyzed: de la mig mi dmigs pa'i rnam par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pas 'dzin pa de bzhi spangs nas yang dag pa'i shes pas mig ni bdag dang bdag gis stong ngo zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ngo //
translated: By not apprehending the eye in any of these four ways, and by knowing it as it truly is, one abandons these four graspings. By right knowledge one sees the eye as it truly is, as empty of self and what pertains to a self.

original: rna ba la sogs pa la yang de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: rna ba la sogs pa la yang de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The same should be applied to the ear, etc.

original: 'di ni gang zag la bdag med pa'i sgo nas gang stong pa nyid bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni gang zag la bdag med pa'i sgo nas gang stong pa nyid bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the teaching of emptiness from the point of view of the selflessness of person.

original: chos la bdag med pa'i sgo nas ni 'di ltar mig la rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: chos la bdag med pa'i sgo nas ni 'di ltar mig la rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: From the point of view of the selflessness of dharmas, the eye is threefold:

original: kun brtags pa'i mig dang / rnam par brtags pa'i mig dang / chos nyid kyi mig go //
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i mig dang / rnam par brtags pa'i mig dang / chos nyid kyi mig go //
translated: the imagined eye, the discrimination eye, and the reality eye.

original: de la brjod par bya ba dang / rjod pa'i rnam par bzung ba'i mig ces bya ba'i dngos po ni kun brtags pa'i mig go //
analyzed: de la brjod par bya ba dang / rjod pa'i rnam par bzung ba'i mig ces bya ba'i dngos po ni kun brtags pa'i mig go //
translated: The imagined eye is the entity that is apprehended as the eye that is the basis of the expression and the expressed.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid du gnas pa mig gi rnam par so sor snang ba ni rnam par brtags pa'i mig go //üîΩ@55a * // brjod par bya ba dang / rjod pa'i rnam pa dang bral zhing brjod du med pa snang ba dang bcas par 'gyur ba dang bral te /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid du gnas pa mig gi rnam par so sor snang ba ni rnam par brtags pa'i mig go // @55a * // brjod par bya ba dang / rjod pa'i rnam pa dang bral zhing brjod du med pa snang ba dang bcas par 'gyur ba dang bral te /
translated: The discrimination eye is the appearance of the eye as the individual characteristic of the eye that is the basis of the expression and the expressed.

original: so sor rang gis rig pa yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid de ni chos kyi mig ces bya'o //
analyzed: so sor rang gis rig pa yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid de ni chos kyi mig ces bya'o //
translated: The reality eye is the perfected nature, which is the individual reflexive awareness that is free from the appearance of the expressed and the expressing, free from the expressed and the expressing, and free from the appearance of the individual characteristic.üîΩIt is called the reality eye.

original: de la mig mig gis stong zhes bya ba la mig ces bya ba ni chos nyid kyi mig go //
analyzed: de la mig mig gis stong zhes bya ba la mig ces bya ba ni chos nyid kyi mig go //
translated: As for the statement ‚Äúthe eye is empty of the eye,‚Äù the ‚Äúeye‚Äù is the reality eye.

original: mig gis zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa dang / rnam par brtags pa'i mig gis so //
analyzed: mig gis zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa dang / rnam par brtags pa'i mig gis so //
translated: The ‚Äúof the eye‚Äù is of the imagined and discrimination eyes.

original: stong zhes bya ba ni bral zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: stong zhes bya ba ni bral zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The term ‚Äúempty‚Äù is a synonym for ‚Äúdevoid.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du rna ba rna bas stong zhes bya ba la sogs pa la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba rna bas stong zhes bya ba la sogs pa la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be applied to the statement, ‚ÄúThe ear is empty of the ear.‚Äù

original: 'o na brjod du med pa'i don dam pa ni mig gi ngo bo nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: 'o na brjod du med pa'i don dam pa ni mig gi ngo bo nyid ma yin no //
translated: If the ultimate truth is inexpressible, it is not the intrinsic reality of the eye.

original: gal te mig gi ngo bo nyid yin na ni brjod du yod pa nyid du 'gyur na ci'i phyir chos nyid kyi mig ces bya zhe na /
analyzed: gal te mig gi ngo bo nyid yin na ni brjod du yod pa nyid du 'gyur na ci'i phyir chos nyid kyi mig ces bya zhe na /
translated: If it were the intrinsic reality of the eye, it would be expressible. Why is it called the eye‚Äôs reality?

original: de ni bden mod kyi 'on kyang mig la sogs pa dang / gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa 'dus byas kyi chos gang yin pa de thams cad gyur pa'i tshul gyis yongs su grub pa'i rnam pa la ni tha dad du dbye ba med de /
analyzed: de ni bden mod kyi 'on kyang mig la sogs pa dang / gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa 'dus byas kyi chos gang yin pa de thams cad gyur pa'i tshul gyis yongs su grub pa'i rnam pa la ni tha dad du dbye ba med de /
translated: This is true, but the eye and so on, and the conditioned phenomena such as form and sound, all of these are not differentiated in the aspect of the perfected reality, which is the mode of being.

original: rnam pa gcig pa yin du zhin kyang gang gi tshe rab tu bstan par bya ba'i phyir rnam par phye ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig pa yin du zhin kyang gang gi tshe rab tu bstan par bya ba'i phyir rnam par phye ste /
translated: Although it is of one aspect, when it is differentiated in order to be taught,

original: smra bar 'dod par gyur pa de'i tshe thabs gzhan med pas gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid sgra'i de bzhin nyid /
analyzed: smra bar 'dod par gyur pa de'i tshe thabs gzhan med pas gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid sgra'i de bzhin nyid /
translated: When you wish to speak, since there is no other method, the suchness of form is the suchness of sound.üîΩ

original: dri'i de bzhin nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra rnams kyis so sor phye ste bstan pa tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: dri'i de bzhin nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra rnams kyis so sor phye ste bstan pa tsam du zad kyi /
translated: When one wishes to speak, one has no other means than to distinguish and teach by means of words such as the suchness of form, the suchness of sound, the suchness of smell, etc.

original: de bzhin nyid de ni de dag gi rnam pa dang / de dag tu brjod par gyur pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid de ni de dag gi rnam pa dang / de dag tu brjod par gyur pa ma yin no //
translated: But that suchness is not the aspect of those words, nor is it expressed by them.

original: de ltar na chos nyid kyi mig la sogs pa gang yin pa de dag nang gi mig gi skye mched la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid dang bral ba'i phyir nang stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na chos nyid kyi mig la sogs pa gang yin pa de dag nang gi mig gi skye mched la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid dang bral ba'i phyir nang stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Thus, the eye of reality, etc., are called ‚Äúinner emptiness‚Äù because they are free from the nature of the inner sense spheres of the eye, etc.

original: de ltar nang gi dngos po la za ba por 'dzin pa bzlog nas phyi rol gyi dngos po la bza' bar 'dzin pa bzlog pa'i phyir phyi stong pa nyid rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: de ltar nang gi dngos po la za ba por 'dzin pa bzlog nas phyi rol gyi dngos po la bza' bar 'dzin pa bzlog pa'i phyir phyi stong pa nyid rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: Having thus refuted the grasping of the inner thing as the experiencer, in order to refute the grasping of the outer thing as the experienced, outer emptiness is presented.

original: bza' bar 'dzin pa yang phi rol pa rnams ni gzugs la sogs pa la bdag gir lta bar 'dzin to //
analyzed: bza' bar 'dzin pa yang phi rol pa rnams ni gzugs la sogs pa la bdag gir lta bar 'dzin to //
translated: The grasping of the experienced is as follows: The non-Buddhists view form, etc. as belonging to the self.

original: chos 'di pa rnams ni yul nyid du rnam par rtog pas 'dzin to //
analyzed: chos 'di pa rnams ni yul nyid du rnam par rtog pas 'dzin to //
translated: The adherents of this doctrine grasp the object itself as a conceptual construct.

original: de la snga ma bzlog pa'i phyir gzugs bdag dang / bdag gis stong zhes bya ba dang sgra bdag dang bdag gis stong zhes bya ba la @55b sogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: de la snga ma bzlog pa'i phyir gzugs bdag dang / bdag gis stong zhes bya ba dang sgra bdag dang bdag gis stong zhes bya ba la @55b sogs pa bstan to //
translated: In order to refute the former, it is taught that form is empty of self and of self-existence, and that sound is empty of self and of self-existence, and so on.

original: gnyis las bzlog pa'i phyir gzugs gzugs kyis stong /
analyzed: gnyis las bzlog pa'i phyir gzugs gzugs kyis stong /
translated: In order to refute the latter, it is taught that form is empty of form,

original: sgra sgras stong zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sgra sgras stong zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: and that sound is empty of sound, and so on.

original: de yang snga ma bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de yang snga ma bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: And this is to be applied in the same way as before.

original: de bzhin du phyi'i yul rnams kyang bdag dang bdag gi dang bral ba dang / kun brtags pa'i chos de dag gi rnam pa dang bral ba la phyi stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du phyi'i yul rnams kyang bdag dang bdag gi dang bral ba dang / kun brtags pa'i chos de dag gi rnam pa dang bral ba la phyi stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Thus, the external objects are also devoid of self and self-existence, and are devoid of the aspects of those imagined phenomena. This is called the emptiness of the external.

original: de ltar phyi dang nang gi za ba po dang / bza' ba'i rnam par rtog pa bstsal nas /
analyzed: de ltar phyi dang nang gi za ba po dang / bza' ba'i rnam par rtog pa bstsal nas /
translated: Thus, having eliminated the conceptualization of the internal and external as the experiencer and the experienced,

original: da ni nang dang phyi'i skye mched rnams 'dus pa'i bdag nyid kyi lus la yang bdag dang bdag gir lta ba dang / lus su rnam par rtog pa spangs pa'i phyir gnyi ga gcig tu bsdus nas phyi nang stong pa nyid du bstan te /
analyzed: da ni nang dang phyi'i skye mched rnams 'dus pa'i bdag nyid kyi lus la yang bdag dang bdag gir lta ba dang / lus su rnam par rtog pa spangs pa'i phyir gnyi ga gcig tu bsdus nas phyi nang stong pa nyid du bstan te /
translated: Now, in order to abandon the view of the self and what belongs to the self in the body, which is the collection of the internal and external sense spheres, and in order to abandon the conception of a body, both are combined into one and taught as the emptiness of the internal and external.

original: lta ba spang ba'i phyir phyi dang nang gi skye mched 'dus pa gang yin pa de dag kyang bdag dang bdag gi dngos pos stong par yang dag par rjes su mthong ngo //
analyzed: lta ba spang ba'i phyir phyi dang nang gi skye mched 'dus pa gang yin pa de dag kyang bdag dang bdag gi dngos pos stong par yang dag par rjes su mthong ngo //
translated: In order to abandon the view, one sees that the collection of the internal and external sense spheres is empty of the nature of self and what belongs to the self.

original: rnam par rtog pa spangs pa yang de dag gcig la gcig ltos te byed par stong pas 'du ba tshegs pa med pa las rnam par bzhag ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa spangs pa yang de dag gcig la gcig ltos te byed par stong pas 'du ba tshegs pa med pa las rnam par bzhag ste /
translated: Abandoning the conception is established from the effortless combination of those, which are mutually dependent.

original: 'di ltar mig ni gzugs kyis stong pas de dang lhan cig phrad nas mthong ba la sogs pa'i bya ba mi byed de /
analyzed: 'di ltar mig ni gzugs kyis stong pas de dang lhan cig phrad nas mthong ba la sogs pa'i bya ba mi byed de /
translated: Thus, the eye is empty of form, so it does not perform the function of seeing and so on by coming into contact with it.

original: don dam par na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: don dam par na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The ultimate is what is meant.

original: de bzhin du gzugs mig gis stong ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs mig gis stong ste /
translated: Similarly, form is empty of the eye.

original: de dang lhan cig tu bya ba mi byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de dang lhan cig tu bya ba mi byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that it does not perform the function of that.

original: de bzhin du rna ba sgras stong /
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba sgras stong /
translated: In the same way, the ear is empty of sound,

original: sgra rna bas stong pas na tshogs pas byed pa me pa'i phyir 'dus pa la lus su rnam par rtog pa spang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgra rna bas stong pas na tshogs pas byed pa me pa'i phyir 'dus pa la lus su rnam par rtog pa spang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and sound is empty of the ear. Therefore, the conceptual thought that the body is a collection is eliminated.

original: de lta bas na stong pa nyid bshad pa'i skabs su nang gi chos rnams phyi rol gyi chos rnams kyis stong /
analyzed: de lta bas na stong pa nyid bshad pa'i skabs su nang gi chos rnams phyi rol gyi chos rnams kyis stong /
translated: Therefore, in the context of the explanation of emptiness, internal phenomena are empty of external phenomena,

original: phyi rol gyi chos rnams kyang nang gi chos rnams kyis stong ste /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi chos rnams kyang nang gi chos rnams kyis stong ste /
translated: and external phenomena are empty of internal phenomena.

original: de la nang gi chos rnams phyi rol gyi chos rnams kyis stong gang zhes na /
analyzed: de la nang gi chos rnams phyi rol gyi chos rnams kyis stong gang zhes na /
translated: What is the emptiness of internal phenomena of external phenomena?

original: mig dang rna ba dang / sna dang lce dang lus dang yid de /
analyzed: mig dang rna ba dang / sna dang lce dang lus dang yid de /
translated: The eyes, ears, nose, tongue, body, and thinking mind.

original: nang gi chos de rnams gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya dang chos rnams kyis stong ngo zhes bya bar bshad do //
analyzed: nang gi chos de rnams gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya dang chos rnams kyis stong ngo zhes bya bar bshad do //
translated: Those internal phenomena are empty of form, sound, smell, taste, texture, and mental objects.

original: de ltar nang dang phyi'i chos rnams 'dus pa la bdag dang bdag gi zhes bya ba med pa dang / nang gi chos rnams phyi rol gyi chos rnams dang bral @56a * //
analyzed: de ltar nang dang phyi'i chos rnams 'dus pa la bdag dang bdag gi zhes bya ba med pa dang / nang gi chos rnams phyi rol gyi chos rnams dang bral @56a * //
translated: Thus, the internal and external phenomena are devoid of the so-called self and entities connected to the self.

original: ba dang / phyi rol gyi chos rnams nang gi chos rnams dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: ba dang / phyi rol gyi chos rnams nang gi chos rnams dang bral ba ste /
translated: The internal phenomena are devoid of external phenomena, and the external phenomena are devoid of internal phenomena.

original: 'dus pa med pas don dam par byed pa stong pa'i phyir phyi nang stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'dus pa med pas don dam par byed pa stong pa'i phyir phyi nang stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Since they are devoid of combination, ultimately the agent is empty. Therefore, it is called ‚Äúemptiness of the internal and the external.‚Äù

original: de ltar stong pa nyid rnam pa gsum yang dag par rnam par gzhag nas 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de ltar stong pa nyid rnam pa gsum yang dag par rnam par gzhag nas 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Having thus correctly established the three types of emptiness, he thinks as follows:

original: ci stong pa nyid ces bya ba chos kyi rnam par yod dam /
analyzed: ci stong pa nyid ces bya ba chos kyi rnam par yod dam /
translated: ‚ÄúIs emptiness a real entity of a phenomenon?

original: 'on te med /
analyzed: 'on te med /
translated: Or is it not?‚Äù

original: gal te stong pa nyid ces bya ba zhig yod na ni stong pa nyid yod pas /
analyzed: gal te stong pa nyid ces bya ba zhig yod na ni stong pa nyid yod pas /
translated: If emptiness were a real entity, then since emptiness exists,

original: stong pa ma yin pa nyid kyang yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: stong pa ma yin pa nyid kyang yod par 'gyur te /
translated: non-emptiness would also exist.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs med par gnyen po yod par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs med par gnyen po yod par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not tenable that an antidote exists without an object that is adverse to it.

original: gal te stong pa ma yin pa yod na yang chos thams cad stong pa ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes de snyam du bsams nas /
analyzed: gal te stong pa ma yin pa yod na yang chos thams cad stong pa ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes de snyam du bsams nas /
translated: If there were something that is not empty, then all phenomena would not be empty.üîΩThinking in this way,

original: yang 'di ltar gtan la 'bebs te /
analyzed: yang 'di ltar gtan la 'bebs te /
translated: one should come to a definitive conclusion.
